revision.text:
A {{nihongo|'''2.5 dimensional musical'''|2.5次元ミュージカル|2.5 jigen myujikaru}} (abbrievated into '''2.5D musical'''), also known as an '''anime musical''', is a type of modern Japanese [[Theatre of Japan|theatre production]] based exclusively on popular Japanese anime, manga, or video games. The term "2.5D musical" was coined to describe stories presented in two-dimensional medium being brought to real life.<ref name="japantimes1">{{cite news | author=Nobuko Tanaka | url=https://www.japantimes.co.jp/culture/2015/03/31/stage/tenimyu-2-5-d-shows-net-2-million-tickets-sold/#.W3C9LsInbIU | title=‘Tenimyu’ 2.5-D shows net over 2 million tickets sold | work=[[The Japan Times]] | date=2015-03-31 | accessdate=2018-08-12 }}</ref>
Approximately 70 2.5D musicals were produced in 2013 and attracted at least 1.6 million people, most of them young women in their teens and 20s. 2.5D musicals are often seen as the starting point of many young actors in Japan.<ref name="japanbullet1">{{cite news | url=https://www.japanbullet.com/news/2-5-d-musicals-based-on-manga-and-anime-popular-with-young-women | title=‘2.5 - D’ Musicals, Based On Manga And Anime, Popular With Young Women | work=Japan Bullet | date=2015-08-13 | accessdate=2018-08-12 }}</ref>
==Definition==
2.5D musicals are defined through make-up and costuming that accurately depicts the actor as the original character, along with exaggerated acting that mimics the original expressions in the original work. It also include special effects and stunts that reenact the setting and tone of the original work. Directors of the musicals are usually the ones who write the lyrics to the songs.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.themagicrain.com/2018/02/interview-with-japanese-music-industry-experts-comic-fiesta-2017/ | title=Interview with Japanese Music Industry Experts – Comic Fiesta 2017 | work=The Magic Rain | date=2018-02-05 | accessdate=2018-08-14}}</ref> With the evolution of technology, some of the modern 2.5D musicals uses [[projection mapping]], in which backgrounds and special effects are projected onto the stage and screens.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://spice.eplus.jp/articles/96302 | title=藤原祐規×演出家・キムラ真インタビュー！ 舞台『PERSONA3 the Weird Masquerade』完結作を語る | work=Spice | language=Japanese | date=2017-01-28 | accessdate=2018-08-09}}</ref> According to the Japan 2.5-Dimensional Musical Association, the term not only applies to musicals, but also plays, comedies, and dramas.<ref name="webjapan1">{{cite web | url=https://web-japan.org/trends/11_culture/pop171214.html | title=“2.5 Dimensional Musical” Live Theater | work=Web Japan | accessdate=2018-08-12 }}</ref>
==History==
The first successful manga-based musical production was ''[[The Rose of Versailles]]'' in 1974 by the [[Takarazuka Revue]].<ref name="japanbullet1"/> At the time, these plays were simply known as "musicals" or "anime musicals."<ref name="interview1">{{cite web | author=Norio Kohyama | url=http://performingarts.jp/E/pre_interview/1511/1.html | title=Presenter Interview: The vision of Makoto Matsuda, the producer behind the "2.5-D Musicals" | work=Performing Arts Network Japan | accessdate=2018-08-12 }}</ref> Around the 1990s, a number of musicals and small stage skits produced were based on anime and manga series aimed at elementary school girls, such as ''[[Sailor Moon musicals|Sailor Moon]]'', ''[[Akazukin Chacha]]'', and ''[[Hime-chan's Ribbon]]'', which performed moderately well, but were not popular and were known as {{nihongo|"musicals for elementary school girls"|女児物|joji mono}}.<ref name="interview1"/> However, in 2000, ''[[Hunter x Hunter]]'' became revolutionary at the time because the voice cast for the original anime series had also played the characters on stage.<ref name="interview1"/>
Japanese media-based musicals rose to popularity in 2003 with ''[[Tenimyu|Musical: The Prince of Tennis]]'' through word-of-mouth and social media, which soon became a starting point for many up-and-coming actors. The shows attracted more than 2 million people during its run and was notable for using stage effects to simulate a tennis match,<ref name="japantimes1"/> and it was popular enough to include its first overseas shows in South Korea and Taiwan in 2008.<ref name="interview1"/> After its success, many productions based on anime, manga, and video games soon followed, some of the well-documented ones including ''[[Naruto]]'', ''[[Yowamushi Pedal]]'', ''[[Haikyu!!|Hyper Projection Engeki Haikyu!!]]'' among others. Unlike productions featuring the Takarazuka Revue, which are supported by fans of the troupe, these musicals mainly draw anime and manga fans and other audiences that usually do not see plays on a regular basis.<ref name="japanbullet1"/>
The term "2.5D musicals" was codified in 2014 when the initial director of ''[[Tenimyu|Musical: The Prince of Tennis]]'', Makoto Matsuda, first established the Japan 2.5-Dimensional Musical Association. At first, despite the success of ''[[Tenimyu|Musical: The Prince of Tennis]]'', he did not consider it a formal stage production on par with most modern theater performances imported from Western works such as [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] productions.<ref name="interview1"/> However, after a group of South Korean musical professionals had acknowledged ''[[Black Butler]]'''s production value and standards in performing arts, Matsuda decided to bring the genre worldwide. Plays certified by the Japan 2.5-Dimensional Musical Association offer theater glasses that contain subtitles in Chinese and English for people who do not speak Japanese.<ref name="webjapan1"/> Starting in 2014, many 2.5D musicals have also been performed abroad in places like China, Taiwan, the United States, and parts of Europe.
In 2018, "2.5D Musical Studies" was added as a program at the Tokyo School of Anime.<ref>{{cite news | author=Jennifer Sherman | url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/interest/2017-02-27/anime-focused-2.5d-musical-school-opens-in-tokyo-in-2018/.112521 | title=Anime-Focused 2.5D Musical School Opens in Tokyo in 2018 | work=[[Anime News Network]] | date=2017-02-27 | accessdate=2018-08-12 }}</ref> In April 2018, actor [[Kenta Suga]], who has starred as Gaara in ''[[Naruto]]'' and Hinata in ''[[Haikyu!!|Hyper Projection Engeki Haikyu!!]]'' became appointed as the overseas ambassador by the Japan 2.5-Dimensional Musical Association, succeeding [[Ryo Kato]].<ref>{{cite news | url=https://enterstage.jp/news/2018/04/009321.html | title=須賀健太「2.5Dアンバサダー」就任！白衣姿で2.5次元ミュージカルの魅力を伝える | work=Enterstage | language=Japanese |date=2018-04-18 | accessdate=2018-08-12 }}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [https://www.j25musical.jp/en/ Japan 2.5-Dimensional Musical Association]

revision.text:
The '''casting couch''', '''casting-couch syndrome''', or '''casting-couch mentality''' is the demanding of [[sexual favors]] by an employer or person in a position of power and authority, from an apprentice [[employee]], or subordinate to a [[superior (hierarchy)|superior]] in return for entry into an [[Job (role)|occupation]], or for other career advancement within an [[organization]].{{cn|date=September 2018}} The term ''casting couch'' originated in the [[motion picture industry]], with specific reference to couches in offices that could be used for [[Human sexual activity|sexual activity]] between [[casting director]]s or [[film producers]] and aspiring [[actors]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2017/10/casting-couch-the-origins-of-a-pernicious-hollywood-cliche/543000/ |title='Casting Couch': The Origins of a Pernicious Hollywood Cliché |work=The Atlantic |accessdate=19 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/browbeat/2017/10/13/_1956_casting_couch_expos_shows_little_has_changed.html |title=In 1956, a Fan Magazine Published a Four-Part Casting Couch Exposé. It Didn’t Go Well. |work=Slate |accessdate=19 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2017/film/features/casting-couch-hollywood-sexual-harassment-harvey-weinstein-1202589895/ |title=Casting-Couch Tactics Plagued Hollywood Long Before Harvey Weinstein |work=Variety |accessdate=19 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-41614221 |title=Exploring the casting couch culture of LA |work=BBC |accessdate=19 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://articles.latimes.com/1991-10-15/entertainment/ca-565_1_casting-couch |publisher=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=15 October 1991 |accessdate=9 January 2018 |title=Scenes From the Home of the Casting Couch: The Talk of the Country Has Hit a Nerve in the Industry That Creates the Images of Women in Popular Culture |author=Elaine Dutka}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/19/moguls-and-starlets-100-years-of-hollywoods-corrosive-systemic-sexism |title=Moguls and starlets: 100 years of Hollywood's corrosive, systemic sexism |first1=Pamela |last1=Hutchinson |newspaper=The Guardian |date=October 19, 2017|access-date=January 9, 2018}}</ref>
Within the [[adult entertainment industry]], content featuring fictitious<ref>{{cite web | title=The Dirty Secret Behind Dirty Movies, by James King and Jesse Lenz (Maxim magazine - April 2014) | website=Pastebin | url=https://pastebin.com/JXZz6baW | access-date=August 22, 2018}}</ref> casting couch scenarios has become a popular niche.<ref>{{cite web |last=Russo |first=Maria Del |title=Why This Woman Wants People To Take A Closer Look At Casting Couch Porn |website=[[Refinery29]] |date=2017-09-06 |url=https://www.refinery29.com/casting-couch-porn-women-problem-directors | access-date=2018-03-04 |df=mdy-all}}</ref>
==Notable casting couch remarks and incidents== ===United States=== * The legend of the [[Cinema of the United States|Hollywood]] casting couch coincided with the rise of the [[studio system]] in the 1910s. Several [[media mogul|mogul]] producers were rumoured to have been enthusiastic practitioners, and it has been claimed that many actresses attempted, with varying degrees of success, to attain stardom via this route.<ref>Freedland, Michael (2009) ''The Men Who Made Hollywood: The Lives of the Great Movie Moguls'', London: Aurum Press.</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=Gil Troy |url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/the-casting-couch-perverts-who-peddled-fairy-tales |title=The Casting Couch Perverts Who Peddled Fairy Tales |publisher=The Daily Beast |date=2017-10-15 |accessdate=2017-10-15}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/19/moguls-and-starlets-100-years-of-hollywoods-corrosive-systemic-sexism |title=Moguls and starlets: 100 years of Hollywood’s corrosive, systemic sexism |work=Guardian |accessdate=19 October 2017}}</ref> * In 1945, [[Maureen O'Hara]] was quoted as saying, "I don't let the producer and director kiss me every morning or let them paw me".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://indy100.com/article/hollywood-sexual-harrassment-in-1945-reshared-8038396 |title=Maureen O'Hara's comment about sexual harassment in Hollywood from 1945 is going viral |work=Indy100 |date=5 November 2017}}</ref> In 2004, she repeated: "I wouldn't throw myself on the casting couch, and I know that cost me parts."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/oscars/11210734/Maureen-OHara-I-wasnt-going-to-play-the-whore.html |title=Maureen O'Hara: I wasn't going to play the whore |work=Indy100 |date=8 November 2014}}</ref> * In a 1996 interview, actor [[Woody Harrelson]] declared "every [acting] business I ever entered into in [[New York City|New York]] seemed to have a casting couch ... I've seen so many people sleep with people they loathe in order to further their ambition."<ref>Stephanie Mansfield, "Wild and Woody", ''Chicago Sun-Times'', July 5, 1996.</ref> * At a 2005 class reunion, producer [[Chris Hanley]] told his former classmates that "almost every leading actress in all of [his] 24 films has slept with a director or producer or a leading actor to get the part that launched her career".<ref>"News from the casting couch", ''Chicago Sun-Times'', June 10, 2005.</ref> * In 2006, a New York City producer was accused of sexually harassing several members of the cast of the [[off-Broadway]] play ''[[Dog Sees God: Confessions of a Teenage Blockhead]]''. She had previously been accused of harassing actors [[Gabriel Byrne]], [[Aidan Quinn]], [[Esai Morales]] and [[Joey McIntyre]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2006/feb/19/gender.arts |title=Turning tables on the casting couch |work=[[The Observer]] |date=19 February 2006 |accessdate=9 December 2012}}</ref> * In 2017, [[Lance Bass]] of 'N Sync wrote that "as a society, we've been become far too comfortable with the pervasive 'casting couch' adage that it no longer resembles what it truly is—sexual assault. ... I grew up in the entertainment business and I've experienced my share of unwanted advances from both men and women who saw me as a target."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2017/biz/news/lance-bass-sexual-harassment-hollywood-entertainment-business-1202605932/ |title=Lance Bass Opens Up About Unwanted Advances ‘From Both Men and Women’ |work=Variety |date=November 2017 |accessdate=5 November 2017}}</ref> * In 2009, [[Megan Fox]] stated that "Any casting couch shit I've experienced has been since I've become famous. It's really so heartbreaking. Some of these people! Like Hollywood legends. You think you're going to meet them and you're so excited, like, 'I can't believe this person wants to have a conversation with me,' and you get there and you realise that's not what they want, at all. It's happened a lot this year actually."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.express.co.uk/celebrity-news/105710/Fox-slams-casting-couch-directors |title=Fox slams 'casting couch' directors |work=Express |date=5 June 2009}}</ref> * In a 2009 interview with ''[[OK! Magazine]]'', actress [[Charlize Theron]] claimed that when she was 18 she was propositioned at an audition by a pajama-clad Hollywood director.<ref>[https://archive.is/20121223100600/http://charlizepics.blogspot.co.uk/2009/02/charlize-theron-nobody-fool.html ]</ref> "I thought it was a little odd that the audition was on a Saturday night at his house in Los Angeles, but I thought maybe that was normal."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/galleries/2012/10/16/susan-sarandon-gwyneth-paltrow-charlize-theron-more-casting-couch-horror-stories-photos.html#9d7ad556-be18-4649-a3a4-37a3a8499c06 |title=Susan Sarandon, Gwyneth Paltrow, Charlize Theron & More Casting Couch Horror Stories (Photos) |work=The Daily Beast |date=2012-10-16 |accessdate=2014-03-03}}</ref> * In a 2009 interview, actor [[Mickey Rourke]] declared: "There's definitely something called a casting couch... if you take a girl from the Midwest with a pretty face and instead of inviting them in for an [[audition]] in the morning, the directors invite them for dinner at night? ... I can recall with certain women, we'd go out, I'd park the car on Sunset and by the time I'd got to the curb there'd be three or four producers handing them cards. ... There's ways you get a job and ways you get a job."<ref>{{cite news |author=Ben Arnold |url=https://www.theguardian.com/theobserver/2009/jun/07/mickey-rourke-what-know-about-women |title=What I know about women: Mickey Rourke, actor, 56, married twice, currently single |work=Guardian |date=7 June 2009 |accessdate=2014-03-03 |location=London}}</ref> * In a 2010 interview with ''[[Access Hollywood]]'', actress [[Lisa Rinna]] said a producer had asked her for "a [[Quickie (sex)|quickie]]" when she was a 24-year-old candidate for a role on a prominent television series.<ref name=rinna>{{cite news |url=http://www.popeater.com/2010/10/11/lisa-rinna-casting-couch-starlit-novel/ |title=Lisa Rinna's Horrifying Casting Couch Admission |last=Shuter |first=Rob |date=October 11, 2010 |work=Popeater |accessdate=May 31, 2011}}</ref> At the same interview, Rinna's husband [[Harry Hamlin]] claimed that a female casting director attempted to seduce him in the late 1970s when he was 27.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.starpulse.com/news/index.php/2010/10/13/harry_hamlin_lisa_rinna_were_both_cas |title=Harry Hamlin & Lisa Rinna Were Both 'Casting Couch' Victims |publisher=Starpulse.com |date=2010-10-13 |accessdate=2014-03-03}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://watch.accesshollywood.com/video/access-investigates:-hollywood-casting-couch-horrors/1314782810001 |title=Access Investigates: Hollywood Casting Couch Horrors! |work=Access Hollywood |date=2010-10-14 |accessdate=2014-03-03 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131027065556/http://watch.accesshollywood.com/video/access-investigates%3A-hollywood-casting-couch-horrors/1314782810001 |archivedate=2013-10-27 |df=}}</ref> * In 2011, [[Corey Feldman]] alleged that children were also victims of the casting couch.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2025357/Paedophilia-Hollywoods-biggest-problem-alleges-child-star-Corey-Feldman.html |title=Paedophilia Hollywood's biggest problem alleges child star Corey Feldman |work=[[Daily Mail]] |date=12 August 2011 |accessdate=12 August 2011}}</ref> [[Paul Petersen]] said that some of the culprits are "still in the game" and [[Alison Arngrim]] claimed that Feldman and [[Corey Haim]] were given drugs and "passed around" in the 1980s.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.americanthinker.com/blog/2011/12/hollywoods_dirty_little_secret_child_sexual_abuse.html |title=Hollywood's dirty little secret: Child sexual abuse |work=[[American Thinker]] |date=6 December 2011 |accessdate=17 December 2012}}</ref> During the [[Harvey_Weinstein_sexual_abuse_allegations|Harvey Weinstein]] scandal in 2017, Feldman launched a campaign to make a documentary to bring down a powerful Hollywood paedophile ring.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/26/corey-feldman-hollywood-paedophilia-child-abuse-campaign-documentary |title=Corey Feldman launches campaign to expose Hollywood paedophilia |work=Guardian |accessdate=26 October 2017}}</ref> * In the November 2012 issue of ''[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]'', [[Susan Sarandon]] spoke of a "really disgusting" casting-couch experience in [[New York City]] in the late 1960s or early 1970s. "I just went into a room and a guy practically threw me on the desk. It was my early days in New York and it was really disgusting. It wasn't like I gave it a second thought. It was so badly done."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/galleries/2012/10/16/susan-sarandon-gwyneth-paltrow-charlize-theron-more-casting-couch-horror-stories-photos.html#11308fb5-a76a-4606-8b8b-1bf4c5e37f9f |title=Susan Sarandon, Gwyneth Paltrow, Charlize Theron & More Casting Couch Horror Stories (Photos) |work=The Daily Beast |date=2012-10-16 |accessdate=2014-03-03}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2217415/It-really-disgusting-Susan-Sarandon-reveals-exploited-casting-couch-young-actress.html |title='It was really disgusting': Susan Sarandon reveals she was exploited on the casting couch as a young actress |work=[[Daily Mail]] |date=14 October 2012 |accessdate=27 November 2012 |location=London |first=Celeste |last=Morgan}}</ref> * In 2015, [[Rebecca Carroll]] wrote a piece about being sexually assaulted when she was 14 by a famous New York City [[TV anchor]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2015/jul/11/casting-couch-coercion-rape-shame-victims |title=The power of the 'casting couch' is in how it's used to shame its victims |work=Guardian |accessdate=13 November 2017}}</ref> * In July 2016, television executive [[Roger Ailes]] was accused of [[sexual harassment]] by former [[Fox News Channel]] anchor [[Gretchen Carlson]]. More than twenty other women, including [[Megyn Kelly]] and [[Andrea Tantaros]], have since come forward with similar allegations about Ailes' predatory casting couch-like behavior in the television industry over a 50-year period.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2016/07/six-more-women-allege-ailes-sexual-harassment.html |title=6 More Women Allege That Roger Ailes Sexually Harassed Them |work=New York Magazine |accessdate=13 July 2016}}</ref> Since then, Fox's [[Bill O'Reilly (political commentator)|Bill O'Reilly]] has also been accused by multiple women of sexual harassment; $45 million has so far been paid to six women.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/21/business/media/bill-oreilly-sexual-harassment.html |title=Bill O'Reilly Settled New Harassment Claim, Then Fox Renewed His Contract |work=New York Times |accessdate=24 October 2017}}</ref> * On 1 November 2016, defense lawyers for [[Bill Cosby]], who has been accused of [[sexual assault]] by [[Bill Cosby sexual assault allegations|over 60 women]], wrote that, "Even if proven (and it could not be), the age-old 'casting couch' is not unique to Mr. Cosby, and thus not a 'signature' nor a basis for the admissibility of these witnesses' stories, let alone a conviction."{{citation needed|date=June 2018}} (Cosby was convicted of sexual assault charges on April 26th, 2018). * On 15 October 2017, [[Alison Doody]] and [[Ruth O'Neill]] recounted their experience of the [[Los Angeles]] casting couch.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.ie/entertainment/movies/the-weinstein-effect-irish-women-speak-out-i-saw-him-openly-grope-women-at-an-oscar-party-nobody-did-anything-36227965.html |title=The Weinstein effect - Irish women speak out: 'I saw him openly grope women at an Oscar party. Nobody did anything' |work=Independent |date=15 October 2017}}</ref> * On 3 November 2017, [[Kyle Richards]] described a producer saying "very perverted things" to her when she met him to discuss a role at the [[Beverly Hills Hotel]] when she was younger.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bravotv.com/the-daily-dish/kyle-richards-jeff-lewis-talk-sexual-harassment-in-hollywood |title=Kyle Richards Tells Jeff Lewis About a Hollywood Casting Couch Situation That Made Her Uncomfortable |work=Bravo TV |date=3 November 2017}}</ref> * On 25 May 2018, Harvey Weinstein's attorney [[Benjamin Brafman]] imparted that Weinstein "did not invent the casting couch in Hollywood."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://pagesix.com/2018/05/25/harvey-weinstein-didnt-invent-the-casting-couch-his-lawyer-says/ |title=Harvey Weinstein didn’t invent the casting couch, his lawyer says |work=Page Six |date=25 May 2018}}</ref> Brafman also later stated: "My job is to defend specific allegations of sexual misconduct, not the issue of the Hollywood casting couch over the last 30 or 100 years," before apologising for using the term "casting couch" and saying that he would "never" use the phrase again.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2018/jun/05/harvey-weinstein-due-in-court-in-new-york |title=Harvey Weinstein pleads not guilty on rape and criminal sex act charges |work=Guardian |date=6 June 2018}}</ref>
===Europe=== * In 1956, British fan magazine ''Picturegoer'' published a four-part casting-couch exposé entitled "The Perils of Show Business" featuring interviews with actresses such as Joy Webster, Dorinda Stevens, [[Anne Heywood]] and Marigold Russell.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/browbeat/2017/10/13/_1956_casting_couch_expos_shows_little_has_changed.html |title=In 1956, a Fan Magazine Published a Four-Part Casting Couch Exposé. It Didn’t Go Well. |publisher=Slate |date= |accessdate=2017-10-13}}</ref> * In 1998 and 1999, producer [[Alain Sarde]] and actor [[Robert de Niro]] were two of the high-profile filmmakers involved in two Parisian court cases exposing the borderline between the casting couch and prostitution for aspiring models and starlets.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/the-princes-and-the-call-girls-1187542.html |title=The princes and the call girls |work=The Independent |accessdate=13 July 2016}}</ref> * In 2002, actress [[Lesley-Anne Down]] spoke of finding fame in the late 1960s: "The casting couch was in full swing, people expected it... My teen-age years were pretty intense, a lot of pressure and a lot of horrible old men out there".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.southcoasttoday.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20020224/NEWS/302249929&cid=sitesearch |title=Actress Lesley-Anne Down's career's definitely on the up and up |publisher=South Coast Today |date=2002-02-24 |accessdate=2014-09-25}}</ref> In a 1977 interview, she had also said: "I was promised lots of lovely big film parts by American producers if I went to bed with them... Believe me, the casting couch is no myth".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20067562,00.html |title=Chatter |work=People Magazine |date=1977-03-21 |accessdate=2014-09-25}}</ref> * In 2005, French film director [[Jean-Claude Brisseau]] was found guilty and convicted of "casting couch abuse" against two actresses between 1999 and 2001 during [[auditions]] for ''[[Choses Secrètes]]'' (2002).<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2005/dec/20/news |title=Director convicted of casting couch abuse |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=20 December 2005 |accessdate=30 November 2012 |location=London |first1=Gwladys |last1=Fouché}}</ref> * In 2007, actress [[Helen Mirren]] claimed director [[Michael Winner]] had treated her "like a piece of meat" at a [[casting call]] in 1964.<ref>{{cite news |author=Tim Walker |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/10033802/David-Cameron-keeps-his-distance-from-film-director-Michael-Winner.html |title=David Cameron keeps his distance from film director Michael Winner |work=Telegraph |date=3 May 2013 |accessdate=2014-03-03 |location=London}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-501948/Helen-Mirren-The-day-Michael-Winner-treated-like-piece-meat.html |title=Helen Mirren: The day Michael Winner treated me like a piece of meat |work=[[Daily Mail]] |date=17 December 2007 |accessdate=5 December 2012 |location=London}}</ref> Asked about the incident, Winner told ''[[The Guardian]]'': "I don't remember asking her to turn around but if I did I wasn't being serious. I was only doing what the [casting] agent asked me – and for this I get reviled! Helen's a lovely person, she's a great actress and I'm a huge fan, but her memory of that moment is a little flawed."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/galleries/2012/10/16/susan-sarandon-gwyneth-paltrow-charlize-theron-more-casting-couch-horror-stories-photos.html#introSlide |title=Susan Sarandon, Gwyneth Paltrow, Charlize Theron & More Casting Couch Horror Stories (Photos) |work=The Daily Beast |date=2012-10-16 |accessdate=2014-03-03}}</ref> * In 2008, actress [[Ingrid Pitt]] described the unwelcome advances of two producers in hotels.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.denofgeek.com/other/11069/the-ingrid-pitt-column-the-reality-of-the-casting-couch |title=The Ingrid Pitt column: the reality of the casting couch |publisher=The Den of Geek |date=2008-01-01 |accessdate=2014-09-25}}</ref> * In August 2012, actress [[Julie Delpy]] spoke out about casting-couch [[paedophiles]] in [[France]] in the 1980s.<ref>{{cite news |last=Longworth |first=Karina |url=http://www.laweekly.com/2012-08-02/film-tv/julie-delpy-2-days-in-new-york-paris/ |title=Julie Delpy Is Fighting Everything That's Wrong With Movies |work=LA Weekly |date=2012-08-02 |accessdate=2014-03-03}}</ref> * In 2013, [[Myleene Klass]] stated that, "I don't think there's a single person in the entertainment industry that hasn't, at some point, experienced the casting couch thing".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/myleene-klass-ive-been-offered-1909699 |title=Myleene Klass: I've been offered work in exchange for sexual favours. it's rife in showbiz |work=Mirror |date=2013-05-25 |accessdate=2014-09-25}}</ref> Earlier, in 2010, she revealed a major Hollywood star (named in 2017 as [[Harvey Weinstein]])<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/4672839/harvey-weinstein-myleene-klass-sex-contract/ |title='HE REVOLTED ME' Harvey Weinstein ‘offered Myleene Klass sex contract’ – but she told him to f*** off |work=The Sun |date=2017-10-13 |accessdate=2017-10-13}}</ref> wanted to sign a sex contract with her.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1315866/Myleene-Klass-A-married-Hollywood-star-asked-sign-sex-contract.html |title='A married Hollywood star asked me to sign a sex contract,' reveals Myleene Klass |work=Daily Mail |date=2010-09-29 |accessdate=2014-09-25}}</ref> * In 2013, [[Thandie Newton]] told [[CNN]] of how, aged 18, she was auditioned by a male director and a female casting director. "The director asked me to sit with my legs apart – the camera was positioned where it could see up my skirt – to put my leg over the arm of the chair and before I started my dialogue, [I was told] to think about the character I was supposed to be having the dialogue with and how it felt to be made love to by this person. It turned out the director used to show that video late at night to interested parties at his house – a video of me touching myself with a camera up my skirt." She declined to name the director.<ref>{{cite news |last=Nixon |first=Tim |url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/film/4796919/thandie-newton-i-was-abused-on-the-casting-couch.html#ixzz2LlkIHHzd |title=Thandie Newton: I was abused on the casting couch |work=The Sun |date=2013-02-15 |accessdate=2014-03-03 |location=London}}</ref> * On 20 October 2017, an article by English actress [[Sarah Solemani]] described the "inappropriate" behaviour of a director when she was 19 and the "appalling" audition room practices of a "toxic" industry.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2017/oct/20/tv-film-industries-toxic-starts-audition-room-harvey-weinstein |title=Sarah Solemani: 'The TV and film industries are toxic – and it starts in the audition room' |work=Guardian |accessdate=20 October 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/castings-auditions-uk-actors-interviews_uk_5a05a516e4b01d21c83e1e69 |title=Three British Actors Explain Why Casting Couch Culture Isn’t Just A Hollywood Problem |work=Huffpost |accessdate=11 November 2017}}</ref> * On 24 October 2017, discussing a sexual harassment he has allegedly experienced, actor [[Kevin Sorbo]] said that "Casting couches have always been around. I don't play that game, nor do I care to."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/kevin-sorbo-alleges-designer-gianni-versace-sexually-harassed-him-1051637 |title=Kevin Sorbo Alleges Designer Gianni Versace Sexually Harassed Him |work=Hollywood Reporter |accessdate=24 October 2017}}</ref>
===Asia=== * In 2003 and 2006, Chinese actress Zhang Yu ([[:zh:张钰 (演员)|张钰]]) released several graphic [[audio recordings]] and [[sex videos]] that she made herself to document her allegations that she won roles through the casting couch.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=6924667 |title=China Debates Morality, Exploitation of Women |publisher=NPR |date=January 20, 2007 |accessdate=2014-03-03 |author=Anthony Kuhn}}</ref> The videos were released on YouTube but have been subsequently removed.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.china.org.cn/english/entertainment/190666.htm |title=Sex, Lies And Videotape: Actress' Disclosure |work=China.org.cn |accessdate=12 November 2017}}</ref> * In 2009, Indian actress [[Suchitra Krishnamoorthi]] reported an incident in her blog where she narrowly escaped sexual advances from a producer while casting for a film role.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/I+experienced+casting+couch:+Suchitra/1/59757.html |title=I experienced casting couch: Suchitra |author= |date= |website=India Today}}</ref> * In 2011, [[India TV]] unveiled a series of exposes on the [[Bollywood]] casting couch using hidden cameras. They showed young actresses routinely being asked by male personalities including actors, directors and producers to sleep with them in return for favours such as a good word to another director or producer. In a follow up interview by BBC, [[Shakti Kapoor]] described "''Will you co-operate with me''" as the code that was used by the Bollywood industry as a proposal to sleep with that person in return for a film role. Other Bollywood entities corroborated this.<ref>{{cite news |title=This world - Bollywood, the casting couch |accessdate=10 August 2018 |publisher=BBC}}</ref> * In 2014, Indian actor [[Shashi Kapoor]] said that the casting couch existed in India in the 1960s for newcomer leading men by established leading heroines. Therefore, he was grateful to star [[Nanda (actress)|Nanda]] for not subjecting him to the casting couch when she agreed to star with him when he was an unknown actor.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraphindia.com/1140330/jsp/7days/18134835.jsp |title=Nanda's last outing |author= |date= |website=www.telegraphindia.com}}</ref> * In 2015, [[Ranveer Singh]] described a "sleazy man in [[Andheri]]" who invited him to his house on the pretext of a lucrative opportunity.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pakistannewshd.com/casting-couch-in-bollywood/it-happens-to-men-too-in-a-shocking-revelation-ranveer-singh-admits-he-also-faced-the-casting-couch-248369.html |title=It Happens To Men Too. In A Shocking Revelation, Ranveer Singh Admits He Also Faced The Casting Couch! |work=India Times |accessdate=11 November 2017}}</ref> * In 2016, actress [[Tisca Chopra]] recounted how she avoided the casting-couch plans of a producer.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.indiatimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/tisca-chopra-reveals-how-she-escaped-a-casting-couch-experience-and-it-s-surprisingly-hilarious-259468.html |title=Tisca Chopra Reveals How She Escaped A Casting Couch Experience And It’s Surprisingly Hilarious! |work=India Times |accessdate=11 November 2017}}</ref> * In March 2017, South Indian actress [[Varalaxmi Sarathkumar]] tweeted about being propositioned by the programming head of a leading TV channel and wrote that "I didn't come to the industry to be treated like a piece of meat."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/blogs-trending-39105285 |title=Actress speaks out against 'casting couch culture' |work=Guardian |accessdate=25 October 2017}}</ref> Other [[Tollywood (Telugu)|Tollywood]] actresses have made similar accusations.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.thetelugufilmnagar.com/2017/04/05/actresses-openly-confess-about-casting-couch-in-film-industry/ |title=Actresses Openly Confess about Casting Couch in Film Industry |work=Telegu FilmNagar |accessdate=13 November 2017}}</ref> * In November 2017, [[Kangana Ranaut]] and several other actresses spoke out against [[Bollywood]]'s casting couch.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pakistannewshd.com/casting-couch-in-bollywood/ |title=In the wake of Harvey Weinstein, Bollywood stars are speaking out about sexual harassment |accessdate=13 November 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mid-day.com/articles/sri-reddy-big-directors-producers-and-heroes-use-studios-as-brothels/19301163|title=Sri Reddy: Big directors, producers, and heroes use studios as brothels|date=10 April 2018|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-he-used-to-force-me-to-have-sex-telugu-actress-sri-reddy-s-shocking-allegations-against-top-producer-s-son-leaks-pic-2603615|title='He used to force me to have sex': Telugu actress Sri Reddy's shocking allegations against top producer's son, leaks pic|author=|date=11 April 2018|website=dnaindia.com}}</ref> * In April 2018, Sri Reddy, an Indian film actress, stripped herself in the public and protested against sexual harassment in the film industry. <ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/08/world/asia/india-actress-topless-metoo.html|title=Indian Actress Stages a Topless #MeToo Protest|first=Jeffrey|last=Gettleman|date=8 April 2018|publisher=|via=NYTimes.com}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Me Too movement]] *[[Sexual abuse in Hollywood]] *[[Weinstein effect]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==Further reading== *[[Kenneth Anger|Anger, Kenneth]] (1959). ''[[Hollywood Babylon]]''. J.J. Pauvert. *Bardot, Bessie & Barker, Geoff (2012). ''Casting Couch Confidential''. Momentum. *[[Derek Ford|Ford, Derek]] & Selwyn, Alan (under the pseudonym "Selwyn Ford") (1990). ''The Casting Couch: Making It in Hollywood''. London: Grafton. {{ISBN|0-586-20386-9}} *[[Michael Freedland|Freedland, Michael]] (2009). ''The Men Who Made Hollywood: The Lives of the Great Movie Moguls''. JR Books Ltd. *[[Ian Halperin|Halperin, Ian]] (2007). ''[[Hollywood Undercover|Hollywood Undercover: Revealing the Sordid Secrets of Tinseltown]]''. Mainstream Publishing. *Hofler, Robert (2005). ''The Man Who Invented [[Rock Hudson]]: The Pretty Boys and Dirty Deals of [[Henry Willson]]''. University of Minnesota Press. *Mutti-Mewse, Austin and Mutti-Mewse, Howard (2014). ''I Used to Be in Pictures: An Untold Story of Hollywood''. Antique Collectors' Club. *[[Julia Phillips|Phillips, Julia]] (1995). ''[[You'll Never Eat Lunch in This Town Again]]''. Random House. * [[Anthony Slide|Slide, Anthony]] (2012). ''[[Hollywood Unknowns|Hollywood Unknowns: A History of Extras, Bit Players, and Stand-Ins]]''. University Press of Mississippi. *Walker, Derek & Hutchinson, Tom (1956). "The Perils of Show Business". ''Picturegoer'', 14 July.
==Further viewing== * [[David Stenn]]'s documentary ''[[Girl 27]]'' (2007) explores the political power of movie studios in 1930s Hollywood, as well as public attitudes toward sexual assault that discouraged victims from coming forward. * Ken Sheetz's documentary ''Discover Me!'' (2012) features a 6-minute section entitled "Sexual Politics" where several struggling actors describe their casting-couch experiences in Hollywood. * [[Amy J. Berg|Amy Berg]]'s documentary ''[[An Open Secret]]'' (2014) follows the stories of five former [[child actors]] whose lives were turned upside down by multiple predators, including the convicted sex offenders [[Marc Collins-Rector]], Brian Peck, Martin Weiss and Bob Villard.
==External links== {{wiktionary}} *{{cite web |url=https://www.postoast.com/casting-couch-in-bollywood/ |title=15 Celebrities Who Became Victim of Casting Couch in Bollywood |first1=Chitra |last1=Chowdhury |work=Postoast |date=November 6, 2016}} *A selection of contemporary articles regarding [http://www.public.asu.edu/~ialong/Taylor41.txt the casting couch in the American silent film industry] from Taylorology. *A storytelling podcast about [http://www.youmustrememberthispodcast.com/ the secret and/or forgotten histories of Hollywood’s first century] by [[Karina Longworth]]. {{Weinstein effect}} [[Category:Film and video terminology]] [[Category:Human sexuality]] [[Category:Sex scandals]] [[Category:Entertainment scandals]] [[Category:Sexual harassment]] [[Category:Sexual misconduct]] [[Category:Sexual misconduct allegations]] [[Category:Sexual abuse cover-ups]] [[Category:Euphemisms]] [[Category:Sexual ethics]] [[Category:Hollywood history and culture]]

revision.comment: Rescuing 0 sources and tagging 2 as dead. #IABot (v1.4beta) ([[User:Josve05a|Josve05a]])
revision.text:
'''Casting television''' is a competition [[television program]] where the winner wins a recording contract, or takes part in a competition.
== Slovakia ==
Slovakia's competition is Superstars, and the prize is a car, cash and recording contracts. Stars such as [[Zdenka Predna]] came to prominence this way.
== United Kingdom ==
Simon Cowell's "Popstars" is perhaps the most famous one of the lot, and other shows on a similar focus are ''[[Stars in Their Eyes]]'', and Andrew Lloyd Webber's ''[[How Do You Solve a Problem Like Maria?]]''.
== United States == Following directly on the UK template is the ''[[American Idol]]'' competition.
== Republic of Ireland ==
Ireland's version, called ''[[You're a Star]]'', had a unique twist: winners came into the Eurovision Song Contest as the prize. However, after the disaster of the [[McCall Twins]] that format has been abandoned. The most famous winner and most successful in Eurovision (though he did not win) was [[Mickey Joe Harte]].
== References == {{reflist}}
* http://www.superstars.markiza.sk{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} * http://www.rte.ie/tv.yourastar{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}
[[Category:Entertainment]] [[Category:Television genres]]

page.title: Central Scherbakov Park of Culture and Leisure

revision.text:
{{Coord|47|59|42|N|37|47|28|E|region:UA_type:forest_source:kolossus-ruwiki|display=title}}
'''Central Park of Culture and Leisure named after Shcherbakov''' is a [[park|recreation park]] in [[Donetsk]]. It is located in [[Voroshylovskyi Raion]], in the west it matches with [[Shakhtar Stadium (Donetsk)|stadium Shakhtar]], and in the north there is the Second city [[pond]].
Park was open in 1932.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://alldonetsk.info/en/central-recreation-park-shcherbakova-donetsk|title=The central recreation park of A.S. ShCherbakova in Donetsk - Donetsk: Information<!-- Bot generated title -->|publisher=}}</ref> There are [[rides]], [[playgrounds]], alleys for hiking and other recreational facilities available for visitors. The park is named after [[Alexander Shcherbakov|Alexander Sergeevich Shcherbakov]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ukrainehotelsonline.com/en/travel-Parks-Donetsk-Shcherbakova-Park/Shcherbakova-Park-Donetsk.html|title=Shcherbakova Park in Donetsk, photo and description Shcherbakova Park attraction of Donetsk, excursions to Shcherbakova Park, entertainment in Donetsk, Shcherbakova Park - the main attraction of Donetsk|first=Ukraine Hotels|last=Online|website=www.ukrainehotelsonline.com}}</ref> who was the Secretary of the Donetsk Oblast Party Committee in 1938. However, the original name was different – at first the park was named after [[Pavel Postyshev|Pavel Petrovich Postyshev]], but the park was renamed after the last had been arrested.<ref name=autogenerated2>{{cite web|url=http://infodon.org.ua/donetsk/139|title=Парк им. Щербакова в Донецке - Донецк: история, события, факты - Сайт о Донецке и его истории|website=infodon.org.ua}}</ref>
==Formation of the park== The park is located in Skoromoshnaya [[gully]], which was the meeting place for workers of [[Yuzovsky metallurgical plant]] and the nearby [[coal mines]] in the 19th century. A [[travelling circus]] stayed here and mass celebrations were held. In 1891 the river was blocked by a dam, resulting in a first city pond that provided the steel works with water. In 1931 they decided to create a park, and in September 1932 10 000 [[Komsomol]] members and the city [[pioneer movement|pioneers]] started work on park creation. 120 hectares of the open steppe land area near river Bakhmutka (First city pond) in the Skomoroshnaya gully was allocated for the park. In 1933 the alleys were established lined with [[chestnut tree]]s, [[lime tree]]s and [[Populus|poplar]]s. On opening day about sixty thousand people visited the park. [[Amusement rides]] started functioning in 1934. Later, the area of the park was increased to 200 hectares, yet reduced to 96 hectares by 2000. At the initial planning except the Central Park there were separate functional zones: a Central Beach park, Amusement park, Regional Park "Medium Ponds", landscape park "Urban forest" and the "Upper" landscape park. The park is located along the coastline of connected ponds, and landscape compositions, most open to the water area direction. In the center the terraces are situated, the lowest of which is the [[parterre]], which is the basis of the composition. The [[Shakhtar Stadium (Donetsk)|stadium Shakhtar]] is built on the upper terrace in 1936 (designed by architects Georgy Nawrocki and S. Severin). In 1932 the park held an agricultural exhibition, for which [[pavilions]] were built. Before 2008 entrance to the park from Stadionnaya street looked like a group of [[columns]] with [[cornices]]; in 2008 it was decorated with ornate metal gates and became a major entrance. In the postwar period in the park there were about a hundred names of [[tree]] and [[Shrub|shrub species]], and the 1955 edition "Donbass Parks" referred to Shcherbakov park as to one of the best parks in Donbas. On November 15, 2008 Donetsk [[journalists]] established "Alley of Journalists". In 2006 reconstruction of the large park started, "Donetskproekt" fulfilled the pre-design for improvement of the waterfront in the park. During the reconstruction the pond embankment was reinforced and purged. In 2008 forged pavilion was established in the park and [[rosary]] with variety of roses was made.
==Sculptures== The sculptural decoration of the park of the Soviet times was ideology-determined. White statue of [[Joseph Stalin]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://infodon.org.ua/donetsk/167|title=Парк культуры имени отдыха (товарища Щербакова) - Донецк: история, события, факты - Сайт о Донецке и его истории|website=infodon.org.ua}}</ref> was established in front of the bridge framed in acacia and dominated over the whole complex of the central park. Behind the back of Stalin statue there was a sculpture of athlete jumping into the water and the fountain with athletes' sculptures who were holding a vase in outstretched hands. In the fountain bowl there was a sculpture of a Sportswoman with ball. Stadium "Shakhtar" was decorated with monumental sculptures on the second floor.<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web|url=http://infodon.org.ua/stalino/142|title=Архитектура довоенного Сталино - Донецк: история, события, факты - Сайт о Донецке и его истории|website=infodon.org.ua}}</ref> The sculptures of the postwar period were dismantled in 1970 during reconstruction of the central part of the park. During the renovation of the park in 2006-2008, a statue of the ancient girl with a [[jar]] was placed on the banking of the "First" pond. Also in 2008, in order to commemorate the City and the Miner's Day the "Good Angel of Peace" was established in the Park as international symbol of [[patronage]]. On the statue basis the names of famous [[krainians|Ukrainian]] [[Patrón|patrons]] are carved: [[Nickolay Tereshchenko]], [[Bogdan Khanenko]], [[Vasiliy Tarnovskiy]], [[Rinat Akhmetov]] and others.<ref>[http://www.ostro.org/regions/34/society/news/article-48369/print.html Остров<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120330131552/http://www.ostro.org/regions/34/society/news/article-48369/print.html |date=March 30, 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rosbalt.ru/ukraina/2008/09/01/519234.html|title=В Донецке русские художники золотом написали имя Ахметова|publisher=}}</ref> In 2008, 46 wooden sculptures depicting fantasy characters were established in the Park.<ref>[http://kp.ua/daily/130808/51296/ В парке им. Щербакова появилось семейство дельфинов - Новости Донецка | KP.UA<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111002091526/http://kp.ua/daily/130808/51296/ |date=October 2, 2011 }}</ref>
==Fountains== The fountain with athletes sculptures was dismantled in 1970 during reconstruction of the central part of the park,<ref name=autogenerated2 /> and replaced by a fountain, surrounded by a [[parapet]]. A cascade of fountains was organized from the central area to the bridge.<ref name=autogenerated2 /> Fountains of the 1970s were dismantled in the 2000s (decade). In 2007 a new fountain, consisting of 6 cups, lined with marble was open in the park. 200 lights are used in the fountain construction. During the renovation of the Park in 2006 - 2008 at the entrance from Stadionnaya street a new fountain was installed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://donetsk.mycityua.com/city/2008/04/18/110200.html |accessdate=August 23, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120331030957/http://donetsk.mycityua.com/city/2008/04/18/110200.html |archivedate=March 31, 2012 }}</ref>
==Attractions== Children's Railway named after Kirov was launched on November 24, 1936. The [[train]] consisted of two coupled together [[trams]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dzd-ussr.ru/towns/donezk/|title=Донецк. Детская железная дорога|website=www.dzd-ussr.ru}}</ref> and the road line length was of about one kilometer. Due to the [[World War II]] outbreak, Kirov Children's Railway ceased to exist and was never rebuilt. The park also previously had a musical shell, a summer theater for 1000 spectators,<ref name=autogenerated1 /> "Green" summer cinema for 2,200 seats, a [[Performance surface|dance floor]], a [[restaurant]], [[parachute]] tower (existed until 1970), reading, [[chess]] and [[checkers]] pavilions. Currently 23 kinds of amusement rides are working in the park,<ref>[http://citylife.donetsk.ua/ten_places/show/sherbakova_park Donetsk City Guide - hotels, sights, restaurants, history, culture<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111009150318/http://citylife.donetsk.ua/ten_places/show/sherbakova_park |date=October 9, 2011 }}</ref> the boat station offers [[boats]] and [[catamarans]] to hire. In 2009 Dolphinarium "Nemo" was open as a part of the national complex of cultural and recreational centres «Nemo».<ref>{{cite web|url=http://novosti.dn.ua/details/98241/|title=В Донецком дельфинарии будут плавать дельфины за 100 тысяч долларов|website=novostidnua}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gazeta.dp.ua/read/v_piku_dnepropetrovsku_doneckie_postroyat_prochniy_delfinari|title=В пику Днепропетровску донецкие построят «прочный» дельфинарий - Газета "Горожанин"<!-- Bot generated title -->|publisher=}}</ref><ref>[http://www.donetskcity.com/sights/delph.php Nemo Donetsk Dolphinarium<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120329231522/http://www.donetskcity.com/sights/delph.php |date=March 29, 2012 }}</ref> The (at the time abandoned) dolphinarium was destroyed in a fire in November 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pda.pravda.com.ua/news/id_7127798/|title=Новини - Українська правда|website=pda.pravda.com.ua}}</ref>
==Gallery== <gallery mode=packed> File:1938. Фонтан в парке Постышева.jpg | 1938, fountain in the Postyshev park File:1939. Памятник Сталину в Сталино.jpg | Monument to Joseph Stalin File:Парк Щербакова 064.jpg | Roses in Shcherbakov park File:Парк Щербакова 080.jpg | Open dance floor File:Парк Щербакова. Фонтан 2.jpg | Fountain File:Парк Щербакова. Добрый ангел Мира 2.jpg | "Good Angel of Peace" File:Парк Щербакова. Ворота.jpg | Main entrance File:Парк Щербакова 103.jpg | Pond view </gallery>
==See also== *[[Donetsk]]
==References== {{Reflist|33em}}

{{italictitle}} {{Infobox media franchise |title = ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'' |image = |imagesize = |caption = |creator = [[Roald Dahl]] |owner = |origin = ''[[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory]]'' (1964) |books = {{Plainlist| * ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'' (1964) * ''[[Charlie and the Great Glass Elevator]]'' (1972) }} |novels = |comics = |films = {{Plainlist| * ''[[Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory]]'' (1971) * ''[[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (film)|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory]]'' (2005) * ''[[Tom and Jerry: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory]]'' (2017) }} |vgs = [[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory video games|''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'' video games]] (1985 and 2005) |tv = |soundtracks = {{Plainlist| * ''[[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (soundtrack)|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]]'' (2005) * ''[[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (musical)#Cast album|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory the Musical]]'' (2013) }} |toys = |music = {{Plainlist| * "[[Pure Imagination]]" (1971) * "[[The Candy Man]]" (1971) }} |plays = |musicals = {{Plainlist| * ''[[Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka (play)|Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka]]'' (2004) * ''[[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (musical)|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory]]'' (2013) }} |games = |radio = |attractions = [[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory: The Ride]] (2006–2015) |otherlabel1 = Candy brand |otherdata1 = [[The Willy Wonka Candy Company]] (launched 1971; owned by [[Nestlé]] since 1988) |otherlabel2 = Confections |otherdata2 = {{Plainlist| * [[Wonka Bar]] * [[Everlasting Gobstopper]] }} |otherlabel3 = |otherdata3 = |website = }} '''''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory''''' is a [[media franchise]]. It includes two books, two live-action theatrical films, two video games, and a ride.{{cite web|publisher=listverse.com|url=http://listverse.com/2013/01/14/deleted-book-chapters/|date=14 January 2013| title=10 Deleted Chapters that Transformed Famous Books|author=Symon, Evan V.}} ==Books== ===''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory''=== {{main|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory}} ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'' is a 1964 [[children's literature|children's book]] by [[United Kingdom|British]] author [[Roald Dahl]]. The story features the adventures of young [[Charlie Bucket]] inside the chocolate factory of eccentric chocolatier [[Willy Wonka]]. ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'' was first published in the [[United States]] by [[Alfred A. Knopf, Inc.]] in 1964 and in the [[United Kingdom]] by [[George Allen & Unwin]] in 1967. ===''Charlie and the Great Glass Elevator''=== {{main|Charlie and the Great Glass Elevator}} ''Charlie and the Great Glass Elevator'' is the [[sequel]] to ''[[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory]]'', continuing the story of Charlie Bucket and Willy Wonka as they travel in the Great Glass Elevator. ''Charlie and the Great Glass Elevator'' was first published in the United States by Alfred A. Knopf in 1972, and in the United Kingdom by George Allen & Unwin in 1973. ==Films== ===First adaptation: ''Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory'' (1971)=== {{main|Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory}} ''Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory'' is a 1971 [[Musical film|musical]]{{cite web | author=Tim Dirks | title=Musicals–Dance Films | url=http://www.filmsite.org/musicalfilms5.html | work=AMC Filmsite| accessdate=25 January 2011}} [[film adaptation]] of the 1964 novel ''[[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory]]'' by Roald Dahl. It was directed by [[Mel Stuart]], and starred [[Gene Wilder]] as Wonka. The film tells the story of Charlie Bucket as he receives a golden ticket and visits Willy Wonka's chocolate factory with four other children from around the world. Filming took place in [[Munich]] in 1970, and the film was released on June 30, 1971. It received positive reviews, but it was a [[box office bomb|box office disappointment]] despite the fact that it recouped its budget. However, it developed into a [[cult film]] due to its repeated television airings and home video sales.{{cite web|url=https://catalog.afi.com/Catalog/moviedetails/54174|title=Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory|website=AFI Catalog of Feature Films|accessdate=June 29, 2018}}{{citebook|author1=Kara K. Keeling|author2=Scott T. Pollard|title=Critical Approaches to Food in Children's Literature|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=k5iMS7khPawC&pg=PA221|accessdate=2 July 2018|date=15 December 2008|publisher=Taylor & Francis|isbn=978-0-203-88891-9|pages=221-}} In 1972, the film received an [[Academy Award]] nomination for [[Academy Award for Original Music Score|Best Original Score]]. ===Second adaptation: ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'' (2005)=== {{main|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (film)}} ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'' is a 2005 [[film adaptation]] of the 1964 [[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory|book of the same name]] by [[Roald Dahl]]. The film was directed by [[Tim Burton]]. The film stars [[Freddie Highmore]] as Charlie Bucket and [[Johnny Depp]] as [[Willy Wonka]]. The storyline concerns Charlie, who takes a tour he has won, led by Wonka, through the most magnificent chocolate factory in the world. Development for another adaptation of ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'', filmed previously as ''[[Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory]]'', began in 1991, 20 years after the first film version, which resulted in [[Warner Bros.]] providing the Dahl Estate with total [[artistic control]]. Prior to Burton's involvement, directors such as [[Gary Ross]], [[Rob Minkoff]], [[Martin Scorsese]] and [[Tom Shadyac]] had been involved, while Warner Bros. either considered or discussed the role of Willy Wonka with [[Nicolas Cage]], [[Jim Carrey]], [[Michael Keaton]], [[Brad Pitt]], [[Will Smith]] and [[Adam Sandler]]. Burton immediately brought regular collaborators Johnny Depp and [[Danny Elfman]] aboard. ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'' represents the first time since ''[[The Nightmare Before Christmas]]'' that Elfman contributed to the film score using written songs and his vocals. Filming took place from June to December 2004 at [[Pinewood Studios]] in the [[United Kingdom]], where Burton avoided using digital effects as much as possible. ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'' was released to critical praise and was a box office success, grossing approximately $475 million worldwide, but received mixed to negative reviews when compared with the original 1971 film. ===Cartoon partial adaptation: ''Tom and Jerry: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory'' (2017)=== {{main|Tom and Jerry: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory}} A direct-to-video animated crossover film adaptation starring [[Tom and Jerry]], entitled ''Tom and Jerry: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory'', was released in 2017.{{citeweb|title=Tom and Jerry: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qs-tu4fi4zA|publisher=Movieclips Extra|accessdate= 3 July 2018}} It stars JP Karliak as Willy Wonka and is dedicated to [[Gene Wilder]], who died less than a year before the release. ===''Willy Wonka's Adventures in Loompaland'' (2020)=== In October 2016 it was confirmed that Warner Bros are planning a prequel film depicting Willy Wonka's "early adventures" prior to the events depicted in the books and films.{{citeweb|url=https://variety.com/2016/film/news/willy-wonka-new-film-david-heyman-warner-bros-1201894143/|title='Willy Wonka' New Film in the Works from David Heyman and Warner Bros. (EXCLUSIVE)|work=Variety|last=Kroll|first=Justin|date=19 October 2016}} However, Warner Bros claims that this movie will not be an origin story.http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/586112/lifestyle/artandculture/willy-wonka-prequel-movie-in-the-works In February 2018, [[Paul King (director)|Paul King]] entered final negotiations to direct the film.{{citeweb|url=https://hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/paddington-director-paul-king-talks-willy-wonka-1080166|title='Paddington' Director Paul King in Talks for 'Willy Wonka' (Exclusive)|publisher=Hollywood Reporter|last=Kit|first=Borys|date=February 12, 2018}} In November 2018, the producer confirmed it would be a prequel film, which would explore the adventures of Wonka before he opened the chocolate factory.http://www.digitalspy.com/movies/news/a870050/willy-wonka-movie-prequel-reboot-david-heyman/ ==Stage== ===''Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka'' (2004)=== {{main|Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka (musical)}} ''Roald Dahl's Willy Wonka'' is a musical that combines elements of both Roald Dahl's book ''[[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory]]'' and of the 1971 movie ''[[Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory]]'' with newly created material.Nicole Arthur, [https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A51662-2004Dec9.html "Sweet Imagination]," ''[[The Washington Post]]'', December 10, 2004 The musical has several versions: the original version which premiered in 2004, the Junior version, the Kids version, and the Theatre for Young Audience version. All are owned by [[Music Theatre International]], the company that owns the Willy Wonka license. ===''The Golden Ticket'' (2010)=== {{main|The Golden Ticket}} The Estate of Roald Dahl sanctioned an operatic adaptation called ''[[The Golden Ticket]]''. It was written by composer [[Peter Ash (composer)|Peter Ash]] and British [[librettist]] [[Donald Sturrock]]. ''The Golden Ticket'' has completely original music and was commissioned by the [[American Lyric Theater]], Lawrence Edelson (producing artistic director), and [[Felicity Dahl]]. The opera received its world premiere at [[Opera Theatre of Saint Louis]] on 13 June 2010, in a co-production with American Lyric Theater and [[Wexford Festival Opera]].{{cite web|url=http://www.altnyc.org/new-operas-for-new-audiences/the-golden-ticket/ |title=The Golden Ticket |accessdate=4 July 2018 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100624034256/http://www.altnyc.org/new-operas-for-new-audiences/the-golden-ticket/ |archivedate=24 June 2010 |df= }} ===''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'' (2013)=== {{main|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (musical)}} A musical based on the novel, titled ''[[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (musical)|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory]]'' premiered at the [[West End theatre|West End]]'s [[Theatre Royal, Drury Lane]] in May 2013 and officially opened on 25 June.{{citeweb|url=http://broadwayworld.com/article/Official-CHARLIE-AND-THE-CHOCOLATE-FACTORY-to-Play-Theatre-Royal-Drury-Lane-Begins-May-18-20120831|title=Official: CHARLIE AND THE CHOCOLATE FACTORY to Play Theater Royal, Drury Lane; Begins May 18|publisher=BroadwayWorld.com|accessdate= 4 July 2018}} The show is directed by [[Sam Mendes]], with new songs by [[Marc Shaiman]] and [[Scott Wittman]], and stars [[Douglas Hodge]] as Willy Wonka. The production broke records for weekly ticket sales.{{citeweb|url=http://www.theatrebookings.com/west-end-winners-infographic|title=West End Winners|publisher=theatrebookings.com|accessdate=4 July 2018}} Coincidentally, Hodge was also the voice of a Charlie and the Chocolate Factory audiobook, as part of a package of Roald Dahl CDs read by celebrities. ==Video games== {{main|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory video games}} There are two ''Charlie and the Chocolate Factory'' video games, one made in 1985 and another in 2005. The games are based on the book of the same name. ==Ride== {{main|Charlie and the Chocolate Factory: The Ride}} Charlie and the Chocolate Factory: The Ride is a [[dark ride]] located in the Cloud Cuckoo Land area of [[Alton Towers]] theme park, [[Staffordshire]], [[England]]. It is based upon the famous [[Roald Dahl]] [[Charlie and the Chocolate Factory|book of the same name]], and takes its thematic inspiration from the illustrations of [[Quentin Blake]]. The ride is split into two segments, the first being a [[Water ride|boat ride]] along the chocolate river inside [[Willy Wonka]]'s Chocolate Factory. Passengers encounter all the characters from the book (going from Augustus Gloop to Veruca Salt) either as simple animatronics or CGI projections. After disembarking the boats the second segment begins with a short pre-show video (involving Mike Teevee). The video is presented as if the viewers are actually trapped within the TV set. The ride continues inside one of two 'Great Glass Elevators' which simulate passengers taking an airborne trip through the rest of the factory. Each elevator is a static room with semi-translucent walls and ceiling on which CGI animations are projected from the outside, and only the floor trembles slightly to give the impression of movement.{{citenews|url=https://www.theguardian.com/travel/2006/jul/08/familyholidays.family|title=Alton Towers Theme Park, Staffordshire|work=The Guardian|date=8 July 2006}} ==Cast and characters==
