{{Infobox media franchise | title = Legally Blonde | image = Legally Blonde DVD box set.png | caption = Cover art for the 2010 DVD box set containing all three films | creator = [[Amanda Brown (novelist)|Amanda Brown]] | owner = | origin = | books = | novels = ''[[Legally Blonde (novel)|Legally Blonde]]'' (2001) | films = {{Plainlist| * ''[[Legally Blonde]]'' (2001) * ''[[Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde]]'' (2003) * ''[[Legally Blondes]]'' (2009) * ''Legally Blonde 3'' (2020) }} | tv = ''[[Legally Blonde: The Musical – The Search for Elle Woods]]'' (2008) | musicals = ''[[Legally Blonde (musical)|Legally Blonde]]'' (2007) | soundtracks = {{Plainlist| * ''[[Legally Blonde (soundtrack)|Legally Blonde: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]]'' (2001) * ''[[Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde#Soundtrack|Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde – Motion Picture Soundtrack]]'' (2003) }} }} '''''Legally Blonde''''' tells the comical adventures of [[Elle Woods]], portrayed by actress [[Reese Witherspoon]] in the series' first two films, a blonde California University of Los Angeles sorority president who enrolls in [[law school]]. The [[media franchise]] consists of three films, a [[musical theatre|musical]], a [[reality television]] series, and a book series.{{cite web|url=http://birthmoviesdeath.com/2016/10/24/jackie-v.-marilyn-the-surprisingly-complex-identity-politics-of-legally-blo|title=Jackie v. Marilyn: The Surprisingly Complex Identity Politics Of LEGALLY BLONDE|author=Bohn, Casey|date=October 24, 2016}} ==Books== {{main|Legally Blonde (novel)}} The franchise is based on the 2001 novel ''[[Legally Blonde (novel)|Legally Blonde]]'' by [[Amanda Brown (novelist)|Amanda Brown]]. It is also the basis of a series of [[young adult fiction]] novels featuring the character of [[Elle Woods]], written by Natalie Standiford.{{cite web|url=https://www.mymcpl.org/cfapps/juvser/title.cfm?id=2717 |title=Juvenile Series and Sequels Title: Elle Woods |work=Mid-Continent Public Library |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150908034223/http://www.mymcpl.org/cfapps/juvser/title.cfm?id=2717 |archivedate=2015-09-08 |df= }}{{cite web|url=https://www.fictfact.com/series/28379/legally-elle-woods|website=fictfact.com|title=Legally Elle Woods}} ==Films== The film series consists of ''[[Legally Blonde]]'' (2001),{{cite web|work=[[The New York Times]]|url=https://www.nytimes.com/movie/review?res=9c04efd9173bf930a25754c0a9679c8b63|title=FILM REVIEW; A Rich Ditz Has Both Brains and the Last Laugh|authorlink=A. O. Scott|author=Scott, A. O.|date=July 13, 2001}} ''[[Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde]]'' (2003),{{cite web|work=[[The New York Times]]|url=https://www.nytimes.com/movie/review?res=9401E6DA123AF931A35754C0A9659C8B63|title=FILM REVIEW; There's Nothing Wrong in Washington That a Little Cream Rinse Can't Fix|author=Mitchell, Elvis|authorlink=Elvis Mitchell|date=July 2, 2003}} and ''[[Legally Blondes]]'' (2009).{{cite web|publisher=[[DVD Talk]]|url=http://www.dvdtalk.com/reviews/36928/legally-blondes/|title=Legally Blondes|date=April 11, 2009|author=Cornelius, David}} In June 2018, [[Reese Witherspoon]] has been in discussions with [[Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer]] to produce a third instalment in the ''Legally Blonde'' film series. In addition to reprising her role as [[Elle Woods]], Witherspoon is bringing back both [[Karen McCullah Lutz]] and [[Kirsten Smith (writer)|Kirsten Smith]] to pen the film's script.{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/2018/film/news/legally-blonde-3-reese-witherspoon-2-1202829366/ |title=Reese Witherspoon in Talks to Return for ‘Legally Blonde 3’ |last=McNary |first=Dave |date=June 4, 2018 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |accessdate=June 5, 2018}} MGM later confirmed in a [[Twitter]] post that ''Legally Blonde 3'' is set to be released on February 14, 2020. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" width:99%; |- ! rowspan="2"| Occupation ! colspan="4"| Films |- ! ''[[Legally Blonde]]''
(2001) ! ''[[Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde|Legally Blonde 2:
Red, White & Blonde]]''

Runtime | 96 minutes | 95 minutes | 82 minutes | TBA |} ==Musical== {{main|Legally Blonde (musical)}} A ''[[Legally Blonde (musical)|Legally Blonde]]'' musical debuted in 2007,{{cite web|work=[[The New York Times]]|title=Candy Worship in the Temple of the Prom Queen|author=Brantley, Ben|date=April 30, 2007|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/04/30/theater/reviews/30blon.html?_r=0}} with music and lyrics by [[Laurence O'Keefe (composer)|Laurence O'Keefe]] and Nell Benjamin and [[Book (musical theatre)|book]] by [[Heather Hach]]. It premiered in pre-Broadway tryouts in [[San Francisco, California]]. In April 2007 the show moved to [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]], opening to mostly positive reviews and grossed more than $1,000,000 a week on several occasions. [[Jerry Mitchell]] directed and choreographed. The original cast starred [[Laura Bell Bundy]] as Elle, [[Christian Borle]] as Emmett and [[Richard H. Blake]] as Warner. It received seven Tony nominations and ten Drama Desk nominations but did not win any. ==Television== {{main|Legally Blonde: The Musical – The Search for Elle Woods}} A reality television series based on the musical, ''[[Legally Blonde: The Musical – The Search for Elle Woods]]'' debuted on [[MTV]] in 2008.{{cite web|work=[[The New York Times]]|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/06/09/arts/television/09hale.html|title=Suspense Is, Like, Totally Total|author=Hale, Mike|date=June 9, 2008}} The show debuted on June 2, 2008, and the winner of the show, [[Bailey Hanks]], in addition to being cast in the role, was given the opportunity to record her own single of the musical's first-act closer, "So Much Better". The show concluded on July 21, 2008. [[Autumn Hurlbert]] was the runner up. She served as Hanks' understudy and performed in the ensemble of the show (replacing Becky Gulsvig who left to join the tour). Bundy's last performance in the musical was on July 20, 2008. Hanks began performances on July 23, 2008 and remained with the show until it closed on October 19, 2008.{{cite news |url = http://www.playbill.com/news/article/122446-Case-Closed-Legally-Blonde-Ends-Broadway-Run-Oct-19 |title = Case Closed: Legally Blonde Ends Broadway Run Oct. 19 |first = Adam |last = Hetrick |publisher = [[Playbill]] |date = October 18, 2008 |accessdate = January 31, 2011 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110914203844/http://www.playbill.com/news/article/122446-Case-Closed-Legally-Blonde-Ends-Broadway-Run-Oct-19 |archivedate = September 14, 2011 |df = mdy-all }} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{imdb title|0250494|Legally Blonde}} *{{imdb title|0333780|Legally Blonde 2: Red, White & Blonde}} *{{imdb title|1015999|Legally Blondes}} *{{imdb title|1229301|Legally Blonde: The Musical – The Search for Elle Woods}} {{Legally Blonde}} [[Category:2000s comedy films]] [[Category:American comedy films]] [[Category:American legal films]] [[Category:American reality television series]] [[Category:Blond hair]] [[Category:Comedy films by series]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:English-language novels]] [[Category:Feminist films]] [[Category:Film series]] [[Category:Film series introduced in 2001]] [[Category:Film soundtracks]] [[Category:Films about fraternities and sororities]] [[Category:Films based on American novels]] [[Category:Films directed by Charles Herman-Wurmfeld]] [[Category:Films directed by Robert Luketic]] [[Category:Films directed by Savage Steve Holland]] [[Category:Films produced by Marc E. Platt]] [[Category:Films set in California]] [[Category:Films set in Boston]] [[Category:Films set in Massachusetts]] [[Category:Films set in Washington, D.C.]] [[Category:Films set in universities and colleges]] [[Category:Government in fiction]] [[Category:Harvard Law School]] [[Category:Media franchises]] [[Category:Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer films]] [[Category:Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer franchises]] [[Category:MTV television series]] [[Category:Musicals based on films]] [[Category:Series of books]]

{{ about|collecting hobbies|other hobbies|List of hobbies}} {{Collecting Hobby}} This is a list of '''popular collectables''' described in Wikipedia articles. The references cited include collector's clubs and societies for each item to support its presence on this list by demonstrating the notability and/or popularity of the collectible.
== Advertising collectibles == : ''For '''print advertisements''', see the section [[List of collectibles#Books, magazines, and paper|Books, magazines, and paper]] below.''
* [[Advertising]] collectables<ref>[http://www.pastimes.org/ Antique Advertising Association of America]</ref> * [[Phillumeny]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.phillumeny.com/|title=British Matchbox Label and Booklet Society working for Phillumeny|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://nwp.phillumeny.com/|title=North Western Phillumenists|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wmmls.co.uk/|title=wmmls.co.uk|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> ** [[Matchbook]]s<ref>[http://www.matchcovers.net/ American Matchcover Collecting Club]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.matchcover.org/|title=Rathkamp Matchcover Society|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> ** [[Matchbox]]es<ref>[**http://www.matchbox-labels.co.uk**/{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} This site no longer exists]</ref> ([[Phillumeny]]) * [[Premium (marketing)|Premiums]] ** [[Radio premiums]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.otrr.org/Pages/Publications/magz_radio_premium_collectors_newsletter.htm|title=Old Time Radio Researchers Group|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reproalert.com/|title=Radio Premium Exchange REPRO ALERT!|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Prize (marketing)|Prizes]] ** [[Bazooka Joe]] comics from [[Bazooka (chewing gum)|Bazooka bubble gum]] ** [[Cereal box prize]]s *** [[Crater Critters]] ** [[Cracker Jack]] prizes ** [[Pin-back button]]s ** [[Tazos]] from [[Frito Lay]] products
=== Brandname products=== * [[Avon Products|Avon]] * [[Campbell's Soup]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.soupclan.com/|title=CC International Home Page|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Coca-Cola]] * [[Disneyana]] ** [[Disney pin trading]] * [[Harley Davidson]] * [[John Deere]] * [[Maytag]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.isasc.org/|title=ISASC|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[McDonald's]] * [[Ronson's Lighters]] * [[Zippo]] lighters * [[Luxury goods]]
=== See also === * [[List of American advertising characters]] * [[List of Australian and New Zealand advertising characters]] * [[List of European advertising characters]]
==Architectural== {{Portal|Architecture}} * [[Fireplace]] * [[Furniture]] * [[Household hardware|Hardware]] * [[Lighting]], [[Lamp (fixture)|lamps]], [[lampshades]] * [[Lock (security device)|Locks]] and [[Key (lock)|keys]] * [[Tile]]
==Art== {{Portal|Visual arts|Photography}} * [[Art valuation|Valuable works of art]] * [[Cultural artifact|Artifacts]] * [[Folk Art]] * [[Indigenous peoples of the Americas|Native American]] art * [[Photograph]]s * [[Printmaking|Prints]]
==Books, magazines, and paper== * [[Advertisement]]s ** [[Absolut vodka]] ads ** [[Got Milk?]] ads * [[Autograph]]s * [[Map collection|Map collecting]] ** [[Globe]]s ** [[Map|Roadmaps]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.roadmaps.org/|title=Road Map Collectors Association - Road Map Collectors Association|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Paperweight]]s * [[Sticker (paper)]]
=== Books and periodicals === {{Portal|Books|Children's literature|Literature}} * [[Book collecting|Books]] ** [[Children's literature]] ** [[First edition]]s {{Portal|Comics|Anime and Manga}} * [[Comic book collecting|Comic books]] ** [[List of DC Archive Editions|DC reprints]] ** [[Marvel Masterworks#Table of Marvel Masterworks|Marvel reprints]] ** [[Manga]] * [[Magazine]]s * [[Magazine clipping]]s * [[Newspapers]]
=== Cards === * [[Artist trading cards]] * [[Phone-card collecting|Phone-cards]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://steveon2.tripod.com/index.html|title=Shannonside CallCard Collectors Club - Website Ver 2.0|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>[http://www.telekortsamlarna.com/eng/ Swedish Phonecard Collectors' Society] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120331084636/http://www.telekortsamlarna.com/eng/ |date=2012-03-31 }}</ref> * [[Playing card]]s ** [[Joker (playing card)|Jokers]] ** [[Tarot|Tarot cards]] * [[Postcard]]s * [[Trade card]]s ** [[Cigarette card]]s ** [[Tea culture#Tea cards|Tea cards]] * [[Trading card]]s ** [[Insert cards]] ** [[Non-sports trading card|Non-sports cards]] ** [[Sports card]]s *** [[Baseball card]]s *** [[Basketball card]]s *** [[Football card (North America)|Football cards]] *** [[Hockey card]]s *** [[Jersey cards]]
=== Ephemera === [[Ephemera]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ephemerasociety.org/|title=Ephemera Society of America|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> is transitory written and printed matter not intended to be retained or preserved. Some collectable ephemera is listed below. * [[Air sickness bag]]s * [[Bookmark]]s * [[Brochure]]s and [[Guide book]]s * [[Tyrosemiophilia|Cheese labels]] * [[Greeting cards]] * [[Door hanger|Hotel Do Not Disturb signs]] * [[Lotology|Lottery tickets]] * [[Matchboxes]] * [[Ticket (admission)|Movie tickets]] * [[Newsletter]]s * [[Passport]]s * [[Pamphlet]]s * [[Postcard]]s * [[Posters]] * [[Public transport timetable]]s ** [[Airline timetable]]s ** [[Public transport timetable]]s ** [[Railroad timetable]]s * [[Sucrology|Sugar sachets]] * [[Tea bag|Tea bag labels]] * [[Tea bag|Tea bag wrappers]] * [[Ticket (admission)|Ticket]]s
==Clothing, fabric, and textiles== {{Portal|Textile arts|Fashion|Knitting}} * [[Brooch]]es * [[Button collecting|Buttons]] * [[Handbag collecting|Handbag]]s * [[Lapel pin]]s * Masquerade [[mask]]s * [[Needlework]] * [[Quilt]]s * [[Patch collecting|Scutelliphily]]: [[Patch collecting|Patches]] and [[badge]]s * [[Sewing]] * [[Textile]]s * [[Thimble]]s * [[Vintage clothing]] and accessories
==Coins, currency, and stamps== {{Portal|Numismatics|Philately}} * [[Numismatics]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.money.org/|title=Home|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://numismatics.org/|title=American Numismatic Society - Main / Home Page|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.numis.org/|title=- Numismatics International - Celebrating 50 Years|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> ** [[Coin collecting]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chicagocoinclub.org/|title=Chicago Coin Club|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dbouge.tripod.com/|title=Silver Dollar Club|author=Dan Bouge|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> ** [[Notaphily]] — Paper currency<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spmc.org/|title=SPMC|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> ** [[Exonumia]] *** [[Token coin]]s ** [[Scripophily]] *** [[Bond (finance)|Bonds]] *** [[Stock]]s * [[Philately]]<ref>[http://aps.org.au/xoops/ Australian Philatelic Society] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120426211908/http://aps.org.au/xoops/ |date=2012-04-26 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bnaps.org/|title=BNAPS|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rpsc.org/|title=The Royal Philatelic Society of Canada|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> ** [[Duck stamp|Federal duck stamp]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ndscs.org/|title=National Duck Stamp Collectors Society Web Page|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> ** [[First day cover]]s<ref>[http://www.afdcs.org/ American First Day Cover Society]</ref> ** [[Postmarks]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.postmarks.org/|title=Welcome to the Post Mark Collectors Club!|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> ** [[Stamp collecting]]
==Film and television== {{Portal|Film|Television}} * [[DVD]]s * [[DVD player]]s * [[Blu-ray]]s * [[Film]]s * [[Film memorabilia]] * [[Film prop]]s * [[Movie poster]]s * [[Television show]]s * [[Laser disc]]s * [[Universal Media Disc]]s * [[Betamax]] tapes * [[VHS|Videocassette tape]]s * [[Videocassette recorder|VCR]]s * [[Video CD|VCD]]s
==Glass and pottery==
* [[Bakeware and cookware]] * China, [[porcelain]], and [[pottery]] ** [[Art pottery]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aapa.info/|title=AAPA|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> ** [[Noritake|Nippon]] porcelain<ref>[http://www.nipponcollectorsclub.com/default.html International Nippon Collectors Club]</ref> *** [[Jim Beam]] bottles<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jimbeamclub.com/|title=Evergreen Jim Beam Whiskey Decanter Collector Club|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Glass]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.glassclub.org/|title=NATIONAL AMERICAN GLASS CLUB - HOME PAGE|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> and [[crystal]] ** [[Art glass]] ** [[Bottle]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fohbc.com/|title=Glass and Porcelain insulators www.insulators.info|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> *** [[Beer bottle]]s *** [[Milk bottle]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.collectoronline.com/NAMBC/|title=NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF MILK BOTTLE COLLECTORS (NAMBC)|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150201211516/http://www.collectoronline.com/NAMBC/|archive-date=1 February 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> *** [[Perfume bottle]]s *** [[Snuff bottle]]s *** [[Wine bottle]]s ** [[Champagne stemware]] ** [[Cocktail glass]] ** [[Depression glass]] ** [[Insulator (electrical)]] ** [[Lead glass]] ** [[Margarita glass]] ** [[Martini glass]] ** [[Paperweights]] ** [[Pressed glass|Pattern glass]]<ref>[http://www.eapgs.org/index.htm Early American Pattern Glass Society] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110606051102/http://www.eapgs.org/index.htm |date=2011-06-06 }}</ref> ** [[Shot glass]] ** [[Wine glass]]
==Household== * [[Antiques]] * [[Home appliances|Appliances]] * [[Bell (musical instrument)|Bell]]s and [[handbells]] * [[Beverage coaster]]s * [[Candle]]s * [[Christmas ornament]]s * [[Cork (material)|Corks]] * [[Corkscrew]]s * [[Figurine]]s ** Decorative [[nutcracker]]s ** [[Netsuke]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.netsuke.org/|title=International Netsuke Society - Home|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Jewelry]] and [[gemstone]]s * [[Keyring]]s * [[Music box]]es * [[Perfume bottle]]s * [[Snow globe]]s * [[Sterling silver]] * [[food utensil|Utensils]] and [[Silver (household)|silver]]ware
==Kitchen collectibles== * [[Bottle cap]]s * [[Beverage can]]s ** [[Tab (beverage can)|Beverage can tabs]] * [[Cast iron cookware]] * [[Cookie cutter]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cookiecuttercollectorsclub.com|title=Cookie Cutter Collectors Club|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Cookie jar]]s * [[Hip flask]]s * [[Houseware]]s * [[Lunch box]]es * [[Mason jar]]s * [[Mug]]s * [[Refrigerator magnet]]s * Shakers: [[Salt shaker|salt]], pepper, sugar * [[Tea bag]]s * [[Teacup]]s and [[saucer]]s * [[Teapot]]s
== Memorabilia == '''Memorabilia''' includes collectables related to a person, organization, event or media. For items collected while traveling, see [[Souvenir]]. For items with other themes, see the [[List of collectibles#Theme|Theme]] section below.
=== Event memorabilia === * [[Sports memorabilia]] ** [[Autographed baseball|Baseball]]s and [[baseball bat]]s ** [[Boxing]] fight programs and posters * [[World's Fair]]
=== Media memorabilia === * [[Film memorabilia]] * [[Film prop]]s * [[Movie poster]]s
=== Organization memorabilia === * [[Police memorabilia collecting|Police memorabilia]] ** [[Police patch collecting|Police patches]] * Political ** [[Bumper stickers]] ** [[Campaign button (political)|Campaign button]]s ** [[Nazi memorabilia]] * [[Scouting memorabilia collecting|Scouting memorabilia]] ** [[History of merit badges (Boy Scouts of America)]]
==Music== * [[Compact Disc|CDs]] * [[8 track tape|8 tracks]] * [[Gramophone records]] * [[Jukebox]]es * [[Compact Cassette|Cassette tape]]s * [[Musical instrument]]s ** [[Analog synthesizer]]s ** [[Valve amplifier|Tube amplifier]]s ** [[Vintage guitar]]s
==Nature and animals== * [[Butterfly collecting]] * [[Conchology]]: collecting [[seashells]] * [[Crystal]]s * [[Fossil collecting]] * [[Mineral collecting]] * [[Gemstone]]s * [[Insect collection|Insects]] * [[Oology]]: collecting [[Egg (biology)|eggs]] * [[Plant collecting|Plants]] * [[Amateur geology]]: collecting [[Rock (geology)|rocks]] * [[Skull]]s and [[Skeleton]]s (see [[Maceration (bone)|Maceration]])
==Sports== * [[Golf]]<ref>[http://www.britgolfcollectors.wyenet.co.uk The British Golf Collectors Society] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20000901083504/http://www.britgolfcollectors.wyenet.co.uk/ |date=2000-09-01 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.golfika.com/|title=Golf : Histoire & Collection - History & Collection|author=Jean-Bernard Kazmierczak|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ghsc.ca/|title=Golf Historical Society of Canada|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref>
==Technology== * Antique Arcade Collectibles ** [[Amusement arcade]] ** Coin-operated machines by [[Mills Novelty Company]] ** [[Fortune Teller Machine]]s ** [[Mutoscope]]s ** [[Slot Machine]]s * [[Automobilia]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aaca.org/|title=Home Page Article|author=Super User|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.classiccarclub.org/|title=Classic Car Club of America|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Bicycle collecting|Bicycles]] * [[Calculator]]s * [[Clock]]s and [[watch]]es<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nawcc.org/|title=Welcome to the NAWCC!|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Computer]]s (especially [[History of computer hardware|Vintage computers]]) * [[Fan (implement)|Fans]] (Vintage/Collectible) * [[Firearms]] * [[Firework]]s * [[Fountain pen]]s * [[Ice cream stick]]s * [[Jukebox]]es * [[Knives]] * [[Light bulbs]] * [[Motorcycles]] * [[Phonograph]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.michiganantiquephonographsociety.org/|title=Michiganantiquephonographsociety.org|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * Photographica ** [[Camera]]s ** [[Movie camera]]s and [[movie projectors|projectors]] * [[Radio]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.antique-radios.org/|title=Antique Radio Club of Illinois|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Record player]]s * [[Recording media]] (see [[List of collectibles#Film and television|Film and television]], [[List of collectibles#Music|Music]]) * [[Weighing scale|Scales]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.isasc.org/|title=ISASC|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Scientific instrument]]s ** [[Electronic test equipment]] * [[Singing bird box]]es * [[Sewing Machines]] * [[Telephone]]s * [[Television]]s (especially [[Cathode ray tube|CRT]]s) * [[Tool]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mwtca.org/|title=mwtca home page|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> ** [[Hand tool]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.htpaa.org.au/|title=HTPAA :: HTPAA Home|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Tractor]]s<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cockshutt.com/flexistar/cockshutt.nsf!Open |title=The International Cockshutt Club |access-date=2011-03-09 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110208035600/http://cockshutt.com/flexistar/cockshutt.nsf!Open |archive-date=2011-02-08 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.two-cylinder.com/|title=John Deere Tractor Enthusiasts|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>[http://www.vintagetractors.co.nz/ Waikato Vintage Tractor and Machinery Club]</ref> * [[Vending machine]]s (coin-operated machines) * [[Weapon]]s * [[Writing Implement]]s ** [[Inkwell]]s<ref>{{cite web|url=http://soic.com/|title=Society of Inkwell Collectors|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150218020806/http://www.soic.com/|archive-date=18 February 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Theme== A theme collection includes related or unrelated items that have a unifying theme or common thread<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.paperweight.org/#theme|title=Paperweight Collectors Association, Inc.|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> or a collection which fits the scope of a special interest.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.rarenewspapers.com/?p=2036|title=Collectible themes… additional thoughts…|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> Items in a theme collection might include anything that has a certain company logo, has an image or shape of a specific theme. Besides the examples below, there are many theme collections within certain fields. For example, a theme collection can consist of postage stamps with images of butterflies or paper dolls with a wedding theme. For collectables related to a person, organization, event or media, see the [[List of collectibles#Memorabilia|Memorabilia]] section above.
=== General themes === * [[Airline]] * [[Animal]]s: [[amphibian]]s, [[bird]]s, [[cat]]s, [[dog]]s, [[fish]], [[horse]]s, [[invertebrate]]s, [[pig]]s, [[reptile]]s, etc. * [[Automotive]] ** [[Automobiles]] *** [[Classic car]]s *** [[Vintage car]]s ** [[License plate]]s ** [[Oil can]]s * [[Farming]] * [[Gambling]]/[[Game of chance|gaming]] ** [[Casino chip collecting]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ccgtcc.com/|title=CCGTCC.COM - Casino Chip & Gaming Tokens Collectors Club|author=David Spragg|publisher=|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref> * [[Hawaiiana]] * Orientalia

{{See also|List of world's fairs}} '''List of world expositions''' is an annotated list of every [[World's fair|world exposition]] sanctioned by the [[Bureau International des Expositions]] (BIE), including those recognised retrospectively as they took place (long) before BIE came into existence. The designation "World Exposition" or "Expo" refers to a class of the largest, general scope exhibitions of 3 to 6 months' duration. This list does not include BIE recognized International Horticultural Exhibitions. For other major international exhibitions, in addition to those endorsed by the BIE, see the comprehensive [[list of world's fairs]]. == Category == {| cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" |- |''World Expo'' |BIE-International Registered exhibitions that take place every 5 years and last up to 6 months. All exhibitions in this category, which took place before 1928, were subsequently recognized by the BIE. |- |''Specialised Expo'' |BIE-International Recognised exhibitions that take place between 2 World Expos and last up to 3 months. |- |} ==List by date== {|class="wikitable sortable" !Dates !Name of [[World's Fair|Exposition]] !Country{{cite web|url=http://www.bie-paris.org/site/en/expo-timeline|title=List of International Exhibitions|accessdate=2006-07-14}} !City !Category !class="unsortable"|Theme{{cite web|url=http://www.expomuseum.com/|title=ExpoMuseum|accessdate=2006-07-16}} !class="unsortable"|Notables !Visitors

{{otheruses|Metanoia (disambiguation)}} '''Metanoia''' (from the [[Ancient Greek|Greek]] {{lang|grc|μετάνοια}}, ''metanoia'', ''changing one's mind'') in the context of [[rhetoric]] is a device used to retract a statement just made, and then state it in a better way.Silva Rhetoricae (2006). [http://humanities.byu.edu/rhetoric/Figures/M/metanoeia.htm Metanoeia] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071117043043/http://humanities.byu.edu/rhetoric/Figures/M/metanoeia.htm |date=2007-11-17 }} As such, metanoia is similar to correction. Metanoia is used in recalling a statement in two ways—-to weaken the prior declaration or to strengthen it. Metanoia is later personified as a figure accompanying [[kairos]], sometimes as a hag and sometimes as a young lady. Ausonius' epigrams describe her thus: "I am a goddess to whom even Cicero himself did not give a name. I am the goddess who exacts punishment for what has and has not been done, so that people regret it. Hence my name is Metanoea." Qtd. in Myers, Kelly A. "Metanoia and the Transformation of Opportunity" RSA 41.1 pp1-18. ==Weakening== The use of metanoia to weaken a statement is effective because the original statement still stands, along with the qualifying statement.VirtualSalt.com (2006). [http://www.virtualsalt.com/rhetoric.htm#Metanoia A Handbook of Rhetorical Devices] For instance, when one says, "I will murder you. You shall be punished," the force of the original statement ("I will murder you") remains, while a more realistic alternative has been put forward ("you shall be punished"). ==Strengthening== When it is used to strengthen a statement, metanoia works to ease the reader from a moderate statement to a more radical one, as in this quote from [[Marcus Aurelius]]'s ''[[Meditations]]''
I still fall short of it through my own fault, and through not observing the admonitions of the gods, and, I may almost say, their direct instructions (Book One);The Internet Classics Archive (2006). [http://classics.mit.edu/Antoninus/meditations.mb.txt The Meditations]
Here Aurelius utilizes metanoia to move from a mild idea ("not observing the admonitions of the gods") to a more intense one ("not observing... their direct instructions"); the clause "I may almost say" introduces the metanoia. ==References== {{reflist}} {{refbegin}} *Cuddon, J.A., ed. ''The Penguin Dictionary of Literary Terms and Literary Theory.'' 3rd ed. Penguin Books: New York, 1991. * {{cite book|chapterurl=http://www.virtualsalt.com/rhetoric4.htm#Metanoia|chapter=Metanoi|title=A Handbook of Rhetorical Devices|pages=4|author=Robert A. Harris|accessdate=2010-01-20|date=2010-01-05|publisher=Virtualsalt.com}} {{refend}} [[Category:Narratology]] [[Category:Rhetoric]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2012}} A '''[[microphone]] gaffe''', sometimes referred to as an '''open microphone''' (in [[aviation]], a '''stuck mic''') or a '''hot mic''', is an apparent error whereby a microphone is switched on in proximity of a subject who is unaware that their remarks are being recorded. The error allows unintended listeners to hear parts of private conversations. Errors usually involve live broadcasting in radio or television, and sometimes material is recorded and played back via media outlets. Such events can cause embarrassment for the person or organization involved, sometimes resulting in serious confrontations and employment termination. ==Noted occurrences== ===Television broadcasts=== *In 1999, during a [[Test cricket|cricket test match]] between [[Australia national cricket team|Australia]] and [[Pakistan national cricket team|Pakistan]], Australian [[Scott Muller (cricketer)|Scott Muller]] misfielded a ball and a voice was heard saying, "Can't [[Bowling (cricket)|bowl]], can't throw." Teammate [[Shane Warne]] was suspected, but a cameraman confessed.Article at [http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2003/05/23/1053585706153.html ''[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]''] *On 22 June 2000, Australian newsreader [[Marie-Louise Theile]] was recorded as calling her husband an "arsehole" during what she thought was a commercial break on ''[[Ten News]]'' in [[Brisbane]].[http://www.abc.net.au/mediawatch/transcripts/s144147.htm Transcript, Media Watch, 26 June 2000], ''[[Media Watch (TV program)|Media Watch]]'', [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]], 26 June 2000. Retrieved 22 January 2011. *During television coverage of the [[Canadian federal election, 2000|2000 federal election]], a [[CBC Television]] producer covering [[Stockwell Day]]'s campaign was heard on-air making a gratuitous comment about the [[breasts]] of [[Juliana Thiessen Day]], Stockwell's daughter-in-law. His words were cut off mid-sentence: "This is Logan Day's wife. I've never met her, but apparently she's got tits that'd stop a—" The producer was forced to apologize.[http://dir.salon.com/story/sex/world/2000/12/04/canadian_tv/index.html?sid=1000180 "Breasts across British Columbia"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20050930130446/http://dir.salon.com/story/sex/world/2000/12/04/canadian_tv/index.html?sid=1000180 |date=30 September 2005 }}, ''[[Salon.com]]'', 4 December 2000. *After a defeat for [[Chelsea F.C.]] in April 2004, British [[association football|football]] athlete and commentator [[Ron Atkinson]] said of Chelsea defender [[Marcel Desailly]]: "He is what is known in some schools as a fucking lazy thick nigger." The microphone was open to some countries in the [[Middle East]], with UK broadcasts having already finished. Atkinson was forced to resign his position at [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] and left his role as a columnist at ''[[The Guardian]]'' by mutual agreement.Hughes, Graham. Buzzle.com. 27 April 2004. "[https://wayback.archive-it.org/all/20090316040532/http://www.buzzle.com/editorials/4-27-2004-53440.asp Big Ron's big gaffe]." Accessed 30 August 2006.Webster, Nick. Mirror.co.uk. 18 July 2006. "[https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/tm_objectid=17400905&method=full&siteid=94762&headline=oaps--you-weren-t-meant-to-hear-that--name_page.html Oops! More gaffes you weren't meant to hear]." Accessed 20 August 2006. *In September 2005, during a filming of ''[[Access Hollywood]]'', [[Donald Trump]] and [[Billy Bush]] had "[[Donald Trump Access Hollywood controversy|an extremely lewd conversation about women]]" where Trump said "when you're a star, they let you do it. You can do anything ... grab them by the pussy".{{cite news |first=David A. |last=Fahrenthold |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-recorded-having-extremely-lewd-conversation-about-women-in-2005/2016/10/07/3b9ce776-8cb4-11e6-bf8a-3d26847eeed4_story.html|title=Trump recorded having extremely lewd conversation about women in 2005 |newspaper=The Washington Post|accessdate=October 8, 2016 |date=October 7, 2016}} When ''[[The Washington Post]]'' broke the story during the [[United States presidential election, 2016|2016 presidential election]], in which Trump was the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] nominee, several dozen Republicans renounced their support of Trump.Canham, Matt; Burr, Thomas (October 8, 2016). [http://www.sltrib.com/news/4444721-155/after-video-huntsman-says-it-is Utah Gov. Herbert and Rep. Chaffetz pull Trump endorsements, Huntsman says Trump should drop out after explicit video leaks], ''[[Salt Lake Tribune]]''.Vitali, Ali; Sarlin, Benjy Sarlin (October 8, 2016) [http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2016-election/gop-piles-donald-trump-over-remarks-women-n662276 "Donald Trump Defiant as Top Republicans Flee Candidacy"]. [[NBC News]]. *A series of technical problems on 9 March 2006 forced [[ESPN2]] to switch from its ''[[SportsCenter]]'' broadcast to that of ''[[ESPNews]]''. Caught unprepared by the move, ''ESPNews'' broadcaster [[Danyelle Sargent]] struggled for words, forcing fellow anchor Robert Flores to finish her sentence. After the broadcast cut to taped footage, Sargent was heard exclaiming "What the fuck was that?"Flanagan, Jeffrey. ''[[The Kansas City Star]].'' 21 March 2006. "[http://www.kansascity.com/mld/kansascity/sports/14146473.htm Former Metro Sports anchor has slip of tongue on ESPN]." Accessed 30 August 2006. *On 8 August 2006, [[Network Ten]] sports commentator [[Dean Jones (cricketer)|Dean Jones]] said "the terrorist has got another wicket" when Proteas fielder [[Hashim Amla]] (the first player from a Muslim background to play [[test cricket]] for South Africa) caught [[Kumar Sangakkara]] during a match between South Africa and Sri Lanka. Jones claimed he thought the microphone was off and made prompt formal apologies, but was dismissed from his post.[[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News Australia]]. 8 August 2006. "[http://www.abc.net.au/sport/content/200608/s1708902.htm Dean Jones sacked over 'terrorist' slur]." Accessed 30 August 2006. *On 29 August 2006, U.S. news channel [[CNN]] was broadcasting the live [[Hurricane Katrina]] anniversary speech from [[President of the United States|President]] [[George W. Bush]] when the microphone of anchor [[Kyra Phillips]] was left on. Around 90 seconds of her casual conversation with another woman was broadcast over CNN's coverage of Bush's speech. During the conversation she discussed her husband, whom she called "a really passionate, compassionate, great, great human being," and her sister-in-law, whom she called a "control freak." CNN apologized to viewers and the [[White House]].[[BBC News]]. 30 August 2005. "[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/americas/5297958.stm CNN says sorry for live mic gaffe]." Accessed 30 August 2006. *In August 2007, Australian journalist [[Kerry O'Brien (journalist)|Kerry O'Brien]], presenter of the [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation|ABC]]'s ''[[The 7.30 Report]]'', was recorded criticising his production staff for a mishap with the [[teleprompter]] while a story was running.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tUZW5vULIrA Kerry O'Brien loses it on Aussie TV], ''The 7.30 Report'', Australian Broadcasting Corporation via [[YouTube]], 13 August 2007. Retrieved 22 January 2011. *On May 12, 2008, as a live news [[Cold open|teaser]] was played, [[Sue Simmons]] was reportedly heard angrily exclaiming to a co-worker (later revealed to be [[Chuck Scarborough]]), "What the fuck are you doing?"{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117986340?refCatId=14|title=WNBC shuffles news anchors|first=Sam|last=Thielman|date=2008-05-22|accessdate=2012-10-06|publisher=Variety}} She later apologized on-air for her inappropriate language.{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/sue-simmons-tells-joy-behar-cried-final-days-i-article-1.1168256|location=New York|work=Daily News}}{{cite news|url=http://nymag.com/daily/intel/2008/05/sue_simmons_wants_to_know_what.html|title=Sue Simmons Wants to Know What the F**k You Are Doing|date=2008-05-13|accessdate=2012-10-06|publisher=New York Magazine}} Simmons has said she was attempting to get the attention of Scarborough, who was preoccupied with his computer, but did not realize her microphone was still on.{{cite video|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NFDqZqDCxD4|title=Sue Simmons explains why she dropped the f-bomb|date=2012-10-17|accessdate=2012-10-18|publisher=YouTube}} *On 14 August 2008, actor [[Ernest Borgnine]] was interviewed on [[Fox News]] when he was asked about the secret to his longevity. Laughingly Borgnine responded "I don't dare tell you," but then leaned over to whisper into the ear of his interviewer, but the whisper was caught by the microphone; "I masturbate a lot."{{cite web |url=http://www.breitbart.tv/?p=152013 |title=Anchors Floored After Mic Picks Up Ernest Borgnine’s Shock Secret to Long Life|date=14 August 2008 |work=Breitbart.tv}} *On 2 March 2009, footage of Dutch news anchor [[Eva Jinek]] asking whether to loosen another button on her shirt (which might reveal too much of her [[Cleavage (breasts)|cleavage]]) right before a broadcast, while muttering and shouting mild curses in both English and Dutch, was accidentally leaked to and spread on the Internet. She exclaims "Yeah, boobies!" at one point, continuing with, "Mother of God. Yeah, if you have it, flaunt it!" and citing her mother who might tell her: "I can see your breasts!" She responded the next day, saying she was not annoyed nor embarrassed by the leaked video.{{nl}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=25U-Mec2zH4|title=Eva Jinek NOS Journaal Boobies, knoopjes, moeder en meer. Reactie in De Wereld Draait Door|work=YouTube}} *Veteran [[Sky Sports]] presenters [[Richard Keys]] and [[Andy Gray (footballer born 1955)|Andy Gray]] made remarks that a female referee wouldn't understand the complex [[Offside (association football)|offside]] football rule. This controversy led to Gray being sacked and Keys resigning.{{cite web|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/standard/article-23916636-sky-sports-presenters-andy-gray-and-richard-keys-attacked-after-microphone-picks-up-sexist-remarks.do |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-03-04 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110303195720/http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/standard/article-23916636-sky-sports-presenters-andy-gray-and-richard-keys-attacked-after-microphone-picks-up-sexist-remarks.do |archivedate=3 March 2011 |df= }} * During a telecast of the [[2016 Summer Olympics]], [[CBC Sports|CBC]] commentator [[Byron MacDonald]] was caught making an off-hand remark to a colleague discussing the result of the [[Swimming at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Women's 4 × 200 metre freestyle relay|women's 4 × 200 m freestyle swimming relay]], stating that a Chinese swimmer "went out like stink, [and] died like a pig." MacDonald and the CBC apologized for the incident.{{cite web|title=CBC apologizes after Olympic commentator says Chinese swimmer ‘went out like stink, died like a pig’ |url=http://news.nationalpost.com/sports/rio-2016/cbc-apologizes-after-olympic-commentator-says-chinese-swimmer-went-out-like-stink-died-like-a-pig|work=[[National Post]]|accessdate=August 11, 2016}} ===Political=== {{Main|Political gaffes}} *At the height of the [[Cold War]] in 1984 U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]] was about to appear on a radio interview and, as a [[soundcheck]], said "My fellow Americans, I'm pleased to tell you today that I've signed legislation that will outlaw Russia forever. [[We begin bombing in five minutes]]." The comment, while not actually broadcast, did eventually spread via rumor around the world. It was not appreciated in Moscow.Reagan, Ronald. Audio of Radio Blooper (mp3). 19 August 1984. "[https://web.archive.org/web/20041022042503/http://media1.streamtoyou.com/rnc/BeginBoming-8-19-84-09secs.mp3]". Retrieved 1 September 2006. *On 16 February 1993, U.S. President [[Bill Clinton]] snapped at an aide "Listen, goddamn it. Come here. You can't do that. You can't take me out here with a mayor and a congresswoman and push them back" after a member of his staff tried to prevent Mayor [[Sharon Pratt Kelly]] and Congresswoman [[Eleanor Holmes Norton]] from joining the President walking to a porch for a photo opportunity with construction workers.[http://community.seattletimes.nwsource.com/archive/?date=19930217&slug=1686022 ''Seattle Times''] *In 1993 [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|British Prime Minister]] [[John Major]], after an interview with [[ITN]] political editor [[Michael Brunson]], forgot about the recording equipment. He called some members of his [[Cabinet (government)|Cabinet]] "bastards" and promised to "crucify" them, and saying of recent revelations "I can't stop people sleeping with other people if they ought not to." He also called himself a "wimp" and said that he had no idea how to win an election.BBC News. 29 January 2001. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/1138908.stm "Curse of the open mic"] *Following the [[1994 State of the Union Address]], Ohio Congressman [[Martin Hoke]] was preparing to be interviewed for a live broadcast for a local [[Cleveland]] television station. After being outfitted with a microphone by a female producer, Hoke remarked to another congressman that "She's got ze beega breasts" in a mock [[Italian language|Italian]] accent. Although not broadcast live, the remark was recorded, and was the subject of a report by ''[[The Washington Post]]'' the following day.{{cite web|url=http://nymag.com/nymag/features/coverstory/2165|title=Washington's Sexual Awakening |newspaper=New York Magazine|date=February 9, 1998|author=Eric Konigsberg|accessdate=November 23, 2016}} *During his [[George W. Bush presidential campaign, 2000|2000 presidential campaign]], George W. Bush called ''[[New York Times]]'' reporter [[Adam Clymer]] a "major league asshole" just before a campaign speech to Vice-President [[Dick Cheney]], whose response ("big time") was also audible. The media reaction was intense, with news stations repeatedly broadcasting it and the ''[[New York Post]]'' running two pages about the incident.6 September 2000. "[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/americas/913312.stm US networks relish Bush's gaffe]". Accessed 30 August 2006. Bush said of the incident: "I regret that a private comment I made to the vice-presidential candidate made it onto the public airwaves. I regret everybody heard what I said."[[Urban Legends Reference Pages]]. 27 April 2004. "[http://www.snopes.com/politics/bush/bushcuss.asp Major League Remark]". Accessed 31 August 2006.[[Guardian Unlimited]]. 5 September 2000. "[https://www.theguardian.com/US_election_race/Story/0,,364678,00.html Bush makes major league gaffe]". Accessed 31 August 2006. *During a televised debate between U.S. presidential candidates George W. Bush and [[Al Gore]] during the 2000 presidential campaign, Gore's sighs (in response to some of Bush's statements) were heard through Gore's live microphone. In regards to the incident, Gore was quoted as saying "Both the governor and I have learned lessons about when the microphone is on, and when it's off."{{cite news|url= http://graphics.boston.com/news/politics/campaign2000/news/Gore_campaign_tactics_show_divisive_leadership_Bush_asserts+.shtml|title= Gore campaign tactics show divisive leadership, Bush asserts |accessdate= |author= |last= Johnson |first= Glen|authorlink= |coauthors= |date= 10 November 2000|year= |month= |work= |publisher= Boston.com|pages= |language= }} *On 11 March 2004, following a satellite address to the [[AFL-CIO]], U.S. presidential candidate [[John Kerry]] turned to one of the Union workers he was standing near and said "Oh yeah, don't worry man. We're going to keep pounding, let me tell you -- we're just beginning to fight here. These guys are the most crooked, you know, lying group of people I've ever seen." Although being removed by an assistant at the time, Kerry's microphone was still live and captured his statement.{{cite news|url= http://www.cnn.com/2004/ALLPOLITICS/03/10/kerry/ |title= Kerry blasts 'crooked' Republicans|accessdate= |author= |last= |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= 11 March 2004|year= |month= |format= |work= |publisher= CNN.com|pages= |language= }} His words were presumed to be directed at his political rivals, the [[Republican Party (United States)|U.S. Republican Party]] and U.S. President George W. Bush. Kerry spokesman David Wade later claimed that Kerry was indeed aware that his microphone was recording and was not referring to Republicans in general but to their use of "crooked, deceitful, personal attacks over the last four years."{{cite news|url= http://www.cnn.com/2004/ALLPOLITICS/03/11/kerry.comment/|title= Kerry: Comment aimed at 'attack dogs'|accessdate= |author= |last= |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= 11 March 2004|year= |month= |format= |work= |publisher= CNN.com|pages= |language= }} *On 1 July 2006 a technician did not turn off the audio feed during a closed-door lunch between [[United States Secretary of State|U.S. Secretary of State]] [[Condoleezza Rice]] and [[Foreign Minister of Russia|Russian Foreign Minister]] [[Sergei Lavrov]] amongst others. Journalists, on listening to the 20 minute broadcast, referred to the conversation as "bickering" about the [[Iraq]]i aid programme.Blomfield, Adrian. ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]''. 1 July 2006. "[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/main.jhtml?xml=/news/2006/07/01/wruss01.xml&sSheet=/news/2006/07/01/ixnews.html Condi and Sergei air differences over an open microphone]". Accessed 30 August 2006.

[[Wikisource]] has original text related to this article:
'''''[[wikisource:Bush and Blair conversation|Bush and Blair conversation]]'''''
*On 17 July 2006 a private conversation, afterwards known as "[[Yo, Blair]]", between U.S. President [[George W. Bush]] and British Prime Minister [[Tony Blair]] at the [[G8]] Summit in [[St. Petersburg]] was picked up by a nearby microphone. Bush told Blair he hoped the UN would "get [[Syria]] to get [[Hezbollah]] to stop doing this [[shit]]" (referring to Syria's influence over and support of Hezbollah in the 2006 conflict between [[Israel]] and Hezbollah in [[Lebanon]]), and that by doing so, the crisis would be over. This was reaffirmed by the suggestion to "get Kofi [Annan] on the phone with [Bashar] Assad and make something happen." He also revealed that Condoleezza Rice would visit the area.BBC News. 17 July 2005. "[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/business/5187276.stm Bush lunch chat is caught on tape]". Accessed 30 August 2006.CNN. 21 July 2006. "[http://edition.cnn.com/2006/WORLD/europe/07/18/bush.tape.reaction/ Bush, Blair laugh off microphone mishap]". Accessed 30 August 2006. *On 19 October 2006 during an official meeting with Israeli Prime Minister [[Ehud Olmert]] in [[Moscow]], Russian President [[Vladimir Putin]] was overheard praising Israeli President [[Moshe Katsav]] for raping ten employees of his office.{{cite web|title=Putin’s Remarks of President Katsav’s Might Puzzle Israeli Delegation|url=http://www.mosnews.com/news/2006/10/19/menshealth.shtml|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061109141230/http://www.mosnews.com/news/2006/10/19/menshealth.shtml|dead-url=yes|archive-date=9 November 2006|publisher=MosNews|accessdate=7 November 2006|date=19 October 2006 }} *Before a Fox News interview on 6 July 2008, a live microphone picked up [[Jesse Jackson]] whispering to a fellow guest: "See, [[Barack Obama|Barack]]'s been, ah, talking down to black people on this faith-based... I want to cut his nuts off... Barack, he's talking down to black people" in an apparent response to Democratic presidential candidate Barack Obama's recent speeches on values.{{cite web|last=Goldenberg|first=Suzanne|title=US election 2008: 'I want to cut his nuts out' - Jackson gaffe turns focus on Obama's move to the right|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/jul/11/barackobama.uselections2008|publisher=The Guardian|accessdate=9 April 2012|date=10 July 2008}} *On 28 April 2010 British Prime Minister [[Gordon Brown]] was caught on microphone [[United Kingdom general election, 2010#April|describing an encounter with a female voter as a "disaster" and called her a "bigoted woman"]].{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/election_2010/8649853.stm|title=Gordon Brown 'mortified' by his 'bigoted woman' slur|date=28 April 2010|publisher=[[BBC News]]}} *In June 2010, US Republican Senate nominee from [[California]] [[Carly Fiorina]] criticised the hair of her Democratic opponent, [[Barbara Boxer]] when she didn't realise her microphone was on during an interview for [[CNN]].[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8XtPMq9xxOY Carly Fiorina Open Mic Gaffe], ''[[The Early Show]]'', [[CBS]], 10 June 2010. Retrieved 22 January 2011. There was popular question as to whether this was staged as an attempt to undermine respect for Boxer, or whether it was an honest mistake. *On 8 November 2011 a private conversation between French President [[Nicolas Sarkozy]] and U.S. President [[Barack Obama]] were overheard criticizing Israeli Prime Minister [[Binyamin Netanyahu]]. Sarkozy branded Netanyahu as a 'liar' and Obama expressed his displeasure with having to deal with Netanyahu on a regular basis.The Guardian. 8 November 2011. "[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/nov/08/sarkozy-obama-netanyahu-gaffe-microphone Sarkozy and Obama's Netanyahu gaffe broadcast via microphones]" Accessed 8 November 2011. *On 26 March 2012 at the tail end of his 90-minute meeting with the outgoing Russian President [[Dmitri Medvedev]], President Obama said that he would have "more flexibility" to deal with controversial issues such as [[missile defense]]. He was heard telling Medvedev, "On all these issues, but particularly [[missile defense]], this, this can be solved but it's important for him to give me space." Medvedev told the president in English, "Yeah, I understand. I understand your message about space. Space for you…" and President Obama continued his statement with, "This is my last election. After my election I have more flexibility." Medvedev responded saying, again in English, "I understand. I will transmit this information to [[Vladimir Putin|Vladimir]]."{{cite web|title=Barack Obama gaffe caught on microphone|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/barackobama/9167428/Barack-Obama-gaffe-caught-on-microphone.html|publisher=The Telegraph|accessdate=9 April 2012|date=26 March 2012}} (See also the [[US missile defense complex in Poland]].) *On 11 September 2015, Australian immigration minister [[Peter Dutton]] shared a joke with Prime Minister [[Tony Abbott]], referring to a late meeting as running to "[[Cape York Peninsula|Cape York]] time", and when Abbott replied that "We had a bit of that up in [[Port Moresby]].", Dutton responded with "Time doesn't mean anything when you're about to have water lapping at your door."—a reference to [[sea level rise]] in the Pacific islands. Social services minister [[Scott Morrison]] then drew their attention to the boom microphone above their heads.{{cite news|last1=Knott|first1=Matthew|title=Peter Dutton apologises for microphone gaffe|url=http://www.smh.com.au/federal-politics/political-news/peter-dutton-apologises-for-microphone-gaffe-20150912-gjlaew.html|accessdate=15 September 2015|work=The Sydney Morning Herald|date=13 September 2015}} *On July 25, 2017, following a [[United States Senate Committee on Appropriations|United States Senate Appropriations subcommittee]] meeting, Maine Senator [[Susan Collins]] was caught making disparaging statements about Texas Congressman [[Blake Farenthold]]. Collins, talking to Rhode Island Senator [[Jack Reed (Rhode Island politician)|Jack Reed]], asks him if he heard about Farenthold wanting to challenge her to a [[duel]]. Reed asserts that the congressman did so because Collins "could beat the shit out of him." She then goes on to call Farenthold a "fat guy, he huge" and "so unattractive, it's unbelievable" and references a photo of the congressman at a costume party in pajamas next to a "[[Playboy Bunny|Playboy bunny]]." Farenthold had previously apologized to Collins for his comments about Collins and the senator, in turn, apologized to Farenthold for hers.{{cite news|url=http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/sen-susan-collins-apologizes-to-rep-blake-farenthold-for-calling-him-fat-and-unattractive/article/2629665|title=Sen. Collins apologizes to Rep. Blake Farenthold for calling him 'fat' and 'unattractive'|last=Quinn|first=Melissa|work=The Washington Examiner|date=July 25, 2017|accessdate=August 11, 2017}} ===Other=== * [[Britney Spears]], about to go out in front of her largest ever concert audience in [[Rio de Janeiro]] in 2001, allegedly complained about the organization of her entourage, saying, "Don't tell me that they're just letting the audience just fucking stand out there like that. Oh my God! This is retarded." Her record company denied that it was Spears' voice that was broadcast to the 170,000 in attendance at the event. * In March 2005 [[Charles, Prince of Wales|Prince Charles]] was heard saying, "Bloody people. I can't stand that man [referring to [[Nicholas Witchell]]]. He's so awful, he really is." He was heard to say this while posing for photographers with his sons in [[Klosters]], [[Switzerland]].''[[The Times|Times Online]].'' 31 March 2005. "[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,19769-1548722,00.html Charles attacks 'bloody press' in microphone gaffe]." Accessed 30 August 2006. * On November 4, 2010, radio host [[Don Imus]] was caught on a hot mic mocking an advertisement for the charity [[Kars4Kids]] during a break, calling them a "moron" and telling them to "go to hell". Imus apologized the next day for the gaffe.{{cite web|title=1-877-KARS-4-KIDS: Behind the Most Hated (and Best) Jingle of All Time|url=http://noisey.vice.com/blog/kars-4-kids-the-most-hated-and-best-jingle-of-all-time|website=Noisey|publisher=Vice|accessdate=25 August 2016}}{{cite web | title = MORNING ROUNDUP: Don Imus Apologizes for Telling Kids' Charity Singer to 'Go to Hell'|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/morning-roundup-don-imus-apologizes-36193|website=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=25 August 2016}} * A fictional example was featured in the US political drama ''[[The West Wing]]'', in the March 2002 episode "The US Poet Laureate" (series 3, episode 16). which showed various aspects of the situation, the reactions, criticisms and responses, ending with the suggestion that the gaffe might have been intentional. ==See also== *[[Public relations]] *[[Media strategy]] *[[Media relations]] ==References== {{reflist|30em}} [[Category:Broadcasting]] [[Category:Humour]]

[[File:Joseph Gatt mocap.jpg|thumb|Motion-capture actor [[Joseph Gatt]] wearing sensors on his body]] '''Motion-capture acting''', also called '''performance-capture acting''', sometimes abbreviated as '''MoCap''' or '''Pcap''', is a type of [[acting]] in which an actor wears markers or sensors on a skintight bodysuit<ref> NY Castings, Joe Gatt, [http://www.nycastings.com/dmxreadyv2/blogmanager/v3_blogmanager.asp?post=motioncaptureactors Motion Capture Actors: Body Movement Tells the Story] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140703113656/http://www.nycastings.com/dmxreadyv2/blogmanager/v3_blogmanager.asp?post=motioncaptureactors |date=2014-07-03 }}, Accessed June 21, 2014</ref> or directly on the skin.<ref name=twsWired> Hugh Hart, January 24, 2012, Wired magazine, [https://www.wired.com/2012/01/andy-serkis-oscars/ When will a motion capture actor win an Oscar?], Accessed June 21, 2014, "...the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences’ historic reluctance to honor motion-capture performances ....."</ref><ref name=twsCalgaryHerald> January 25, 2012, Calgary Herald, [http://blogs.calgaryherald.com/2012/01/25/no-oscar-nod-for-andy-serkis-master-of-stop-motion-acting/ No Oscar nod for Andy Serkis: master of motion-capture acting], Accessed June 21, 2014, "..Serkis has carved out a niche for himself as master of motion-capture roles..."</ref> Several cameras from different angles record the actor's movements simultaneously, recording the three-dimensional position of the sensors and not recording the rest of the actor. Sampling is done many times each second, aided by advances in computer technology. The resulting database of 3-D points permits a filmmaker or video game creator to create a digital character and to place this character in an entirely new setting, such as on top of a fictional volcano or flying through the air. This type of acting is seen as a growth area, with predictions that there will be more work in future for actors.<ref name="twsBackstage">Andrew Harris Salomon, Feb. 22, 2013, Backstage Magazine, [http://www.backstage.com/news/spotlight/growth-performance-capture-helping-gaming-actors-weather-slump/ Growth In Performance Capture Helping Gaming Actors Weather Slump], Accessed June 21, 2014, "..motion-capture technology ... indicate that this niche continues to be a growth area for actors...."</ref> Some theatrical agents represent motion-capture actors.<ref name="twsBackstage" />
Motion-capture acting can be difficult work. For example, one actor was "placed in a tiny booth, had dots placed all over his face that captured his movements, and had to sit perfectly still".<ref name=twsBackstage/> One report suggested that actors wishing to break into this line of work should go to acting class and become experts in skills such as gunplay, sword fighting, dance, general body movement, running and jumping, gymnastics, and hand-to-hand fighting.<ref name=twsBackstage/> It is a new type of acting work. Numerous sources identify actor [[Andy Serkis]] as the "king of motion-capture acting" based on his work in creating digital characters in movies such as ''[[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|The Lord of the Rings]]'', ''[[King Kong (2005 film)|King Kong]]'' and ''[[Planet of the Apes]]''.<ref name=twsToday> Gael Fashingbauer Cooper, TODAY, May 26, 2014, [http://www.today.com/entertainment/7-summer-movies-you-shouldnt-miss-2D79591396 7 summer movies you shouldn't miss], Accessed June 21, 2014, "....Andy Serkis, the king of motion-capture acting..."</ref><ref name=twsLATimes>Gina McIntyre, June 04, 2014, Los Angeles Times, [http://herocomplex.latimes.com/movies/star-wars-josh-trank-set-to-direct-standalone-film/#/0 ‘Star Wars’: Josh Trank set to direct standalone film], Accessed June 21, 2014, "..Irish actor Domhnall Gleeson, performance capture expert Andy Serkis ..."</ref> According to one report, the first use of performance capture acting for a video game was for the 2007 game ''[[Heavenly Sword]]'' which starred Serkis and others.<ref name="CBC News"> [http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/performance-capture-injects-emotion-into-virtual-worlds-1.1104828 Performance capture injects emotion into virtual worlds: Using actors' movements, expressions to animate digital characters in games, film allows audiences to relate], March 7, 2011, Blaine Kyllo, "...Heavenly Sword (2007), which starred Serkis and Anna Torv (Fringe ), was the first video game in which performance capture was used..."</ref> Serkis said:
{{Quote|Performance-capture technology is really the only way that we could bring these characters to life. It's the way that Gollum was brought to life, and King Kong, and the Na'vi in Avatar and so on and it's really another way of capturing an actor's performance. That's all it is, digital make-up.|[[Andy Serkis]], 2011<ref name=twsGuardian> Ben Child, 12 August 2011, The Guardian, [https://www.theguardian.com/film/2011/aug/12/andy-serkis-motion-capture-acting Andy Serkis: why won't Oscars go ape over motion-capture acting? Star of Rise of the Planet of the Apes says performance capture is misunderstood and its actors deserve more respect], Accessed June 21, 2014</ref>}}
There have been battles within the film industry about earning recognition for motion-capture actors. The Alliance of Motion Picture & Television Producers does not consider motion-capture acting as the same type of work as acting, which means that motion-capture actors are often paid less.<ref name=twsVariety/> The [[Screen Actors Guild]] (SAG) has lobbied the industry for better employment terms and conditions for motion-capture actors, and argued that motion-capture work should be included in standard labor contracts.<ref name=twsVariety> Dave McNary, December 17, 2011, Variety magazine, [https://variety.com/2011/digital/news/motion-capture-tests-acting-boundaries-1118047652/ Motion-capture tests acting boundaries], Accessed June 21, 2014, "..The Screen Actors Guild ... are the characters in these films ... performing as genuine actors or something else?..."</ref><ref> Dave McNary, December 17, 2011, Variety magazine, [https://variety.com/2011/digital/news/motion-capture-tests-acting-boundaries-1118047652/ Motion-capture tests acting boundaries], Accessed June 21, 2014</ref> The industry in 2012 did not give awards for motion-capture acting.<ref name=twsHollywood> KELSEA STAHLER, DEC 07, 2012, Hollywood.com, [http://www.hollywood.com/news/movies/45718147/andy-serkis-at-the-hobbit-premiere-gollum-motion-capture-acting-is-just-acting?page=all Andy Serkis at ‘The Hobbit’ Premiere: Gollum Motion Capture Acting Is ‘Just Acting’], Accessed June 21, 2014, "..Some film experts have had trouble categorizing the master motion capture actor, The Hobbit star Andy Serkis, ..."</ref>
==See also== * [[Human image synthesis]] * [[Motion capture]]
